We will be near the village of Srithanu, Zen beach, Hin Kong and a short distance from Koh Phangan's main pier. This beautiful island already has a huge amount of vegan restaurants and eateries to cater for the existing eco-conscious and compassionate community.  
At the foot of a mountain and surrounded by national park, our luxury paradise location will provide breathtaking scenery in every direction. Nestled under tall coconut palms, among an abundance of native fruit trees and flower bushes, PlantLife will be the perfect setting for a tranquil and secluded luxury experience.
 
What We Need & What You Get
There’s no doubt this is a HUGE project, and it’s the largest crowd funding campaign for a hotel, EVER. We’re asking for your support to raise a whopping $870,000 - It’s a whole lot of money so we need a whole lot of people to get involved. 
PlantLife is a collaborative project that we have been developing for just over a year. This means that instead of VC’s providing a capital injection, we’re essentially sharing the company between a few invested parties.
Our collaborative structure means we’ve managed to reduce our initial startup costs by a whole bunch, as well as introducing new and exciting collaborative ideas by some pretty passionate people. 


Where the money will be going
​So you're probably thinking, so what do you need us for?... Well there are a lot of other expenses that we will need to cover in order to get PlantLife off the ground.
 
What if we do not meet our target?
If we do not meet our target before the campaign ends, unfortunately, the campaign will be cancelled, you will all be refunded and we will have to attack this mountain from a different angle. Because we need so many people to be involved in this campaign, it means that you’ve got to share the hell out of this link! - otherwise it will take much, much longer to complete the project. We are determined and tenacious. We know there may be bumps and hurdles along the way, but we are confident that PlantLife will become a reality.
What if we get overfunded?
Overfunding opens us up to the possibility of increasing our current land-plot size, which will allow us to build more villas. Any extra money that we raise will also give us a little extra padding to fall back on, which would be incredibly helpful as a new company. 

 

Guests & Memberships 
 


Vegan Jasmine Members
Along with the Jasmine membership perks, your contribution will help to share the deliciousness of veganism. We will take to the streets with persuasive vegan goodies and attract the masses by giving them away for free! Every Vegan Jasmine Member will be represented by a delicious vegan cupcake and given to an an unsuspecting member of the public!
Eco Jasmine Members
Along with the Jasmine membership perks, your contribution will help clean up our planet little by little. Every time someone becomes an Eco Jasmine Member we will pick up 1 bin bag of trash, removing it from Thailand's beautiful scenery. 
For-The-Animals Jasmine Members
Along with the Jasmine membership perks, your contribution will brighten the day of a stray. Every time someone becomes an Eco Jasmine Member, we will dedicate 15 minutes of love and play to a stray animal in need. 
 
 

Vegan Lotus Members
Along with the Lotus Guest perks, your contribution will help show the world how veganism can improve your health and vitality. We will storm the local fitness clubs with delicious and healthy vegan treats and entice the exercise enthusiasts by nourishing them for free! Every Vegan Lotus Member will be represented by a delicious healthy treat and given to an an unsuspecting fitness fanatic!
Eco Lotus Members
Along with the Lotus Guest perks, your contribution will help reduce our plastic use one step at a time. We will visit a local fruit and veg market in Bangkok that is notorious for excessive plastic bag use, and hand out free reusable bags to unsuspecting shoppers. For every Eco Lotus Member, we will give away 10 reusable bags. 
For-The-Animals Lotus Members
Along with the Lotus Guest perks, your contribution will bring a shelter animal one step closer to finding their forever home. For every For-The-Animals Lotus Member, we will head to our local animal shelter to photograph and film an animal who has been especially difficult to find a forever home for. We will send 1 beautiful paw-trait and a 15 second video to the shelter for them to use to showcase the animals' personality to a whole load of potential forever families. 
 
 

Vegan Coconut Members
Along with your Coconut Guest perks, your contribution will help support animal shelters and the individual animals who are in desperate need of love and attention. For every Vegan Coconut Guest that backs us, a PlantLife founder will spend a day volunteering at an animal shelter, feeding, playing, cleaning and generally caring for sick, injured or caged cat and dogs.
Eco Coconut Members
Along with your Coconut Guest perks, your contribution will help us to demonstrate and bring awareness to the impact of climate change. For every 5 Eco Coconut backers, we will organise a free film screening in Bangkok showcasing a hard hitting and informative, environmental documentary Film.
For The Animals Coconut Members
Along with your Coconut Guest perks, your contribution will bring us one step closer to unveiling worldwide animal abuse and the environmental and public health importance of a global shift towards veganism. For every 5 For-The-Animals Coconut backers, we will organise a free film screening in Bangkok showcasing a hard hitting and informative, vegan documentary Film.
 
 

 
Our Partners 
PlantLife will be a collaborative project; this means that instead of VC’s providing a capital injection, we’re essentially sharing the company between a few invested parties. Our collaborative structure means we’ve managed to reduce our initial startup costs by a whole bunch, as well as introducing new and exciting collaborative ideas by some pretty passionate people.
The invested collaborators will be as follows:
         - A Thai construction company with knowledge on how to implement eco and solar practices into the build.
         - A Thai architect experienced in designing eco conscious and sustainable buildings.
         - The land owner.  
And our on board consultants will help us ensure that we are as eco friendly and solar efficient as possible.      

 
The Impact
Think about the last time you went to a luxury hotel... or any hotel for that matter. Think about all the tiny details that you may not have noticed at the time. The plastic use, energy use, food wastage or even the type of food served at the hotel. Every tiny detail, even down to the impact that hotel has on its local community adds up. From a lot of seemingly small decisions that that hotel has made somewhere down the line, one big impact and footprint is created. 



 
Experiences
We are focused on offering our guests authentic travel experiences that enrich our local community and give our guests memorable travel experiences. All of PlantLife's experiences are centred around Thai culture, our local community, sustainable living, animal welfare and the plant based lifestyle. For our full list of experiences, head over to our website. 
https://www.plantlifehotel.com/experience 




 
Restaurant 
PlantLife restaurant will be a luxury, plant based dining experience. Our extensive menu boasts healthy and delicious dishes created with fresh, seasonal and local ingredients. We will tailor our menu for each season. 
Check out our full menu at our website address below:
www.plantlifehotel.com/restaurant
But here are a few pages for a taster...



 
Animal Residents Care
(A long but necessary explanation!)
ALL of our animal residents will be neutered, spayed & vaccinated with no exceptions. 
Donations are often the only way shelters & sanctuaries survive. This means that, unfortunately, many of these shelters are so underfunded that the animals end up living in cramped and miserable conditions. We have seen this first hand and it is very sad to see. Although these animals are better off in these shelters with the medical care that they need, they are often still cooped up. 
We have met and spoken to animal shelters and rescuers on Koh Phangan in regards to adopting animals who are most in need of a home; think of us as a halfway home for animals that are recovered, vaccinated, neutered/spayed and awaiting their forever home! All of these animals will be adoptable if guests take a shine to them. We will facilitate this with the help of animal shelters and relocators here in Thailand. This will enable us to keep adopting animals. 
We will have a full-time, animal carer on-site, dedicated to ensuring that the animals are well looked after. We will also have an animal safe zone on the premises with a quarantine zone (similar to a small veterinary surgery) and emergency medical supplies and vaccinations. We will be partnering with local vets to give our animals routine check ups and vaccinations on a regular basis.
Unlike most sanctuaries with limited space and resources, our animals will be free to roam the 19,200 sqm area; we have nooks, hideaways and shrouded areas for them to explore and play. PlantLife will be surrounded by a very tall and cat-proof perimeter wall, to ensure that the animals are kept safe and sound on our premises, and to ensure that no potentially sick animals can wander on site before they have been treated and vaccinated.
We know that cats are natural hunters and we will be taking all the steps we can, to make sure this does not impact our natural wildlife. All cats will wear bell collars to minimise any unfortunate incidents. We will also be taking all the measures possible to keep any potentially dangerous critters such as snakes off the premises and away from our guests and animal residents. 
We believe it is important for our guests to understand why we do what we do, and to remember that we are not a petting zoo, or a place where the animals serve as entertainment for us. We will provide our guests with information and education on the plight of feral & free-roaming animals & their affect on wildlife.
 

Cat Food
Although we aim to be 100% vegan in every aspect of our hotel operations, cat food will be one area in which we will not be able to be totally vegan, for fear of compromising our cats’ health. Dogs can be fed a plant based diet and are not obligate carnivores. They can, and do, thrive on a properly formulated vegan diet including foods like rice, sweet potatoes, carrots, lentils and other plant-based foods. In fact, one of the longest lifetime lengths recorded for a dog is 27 years or 189 years in dog years, was from a dog named Bramble who was vegan and her story is quite famous!
Cats, however, are hyper carnivorous (or obligate carnivores) and require taurine found in meat to keep them healthy. In an ideal scenario, animals would catch their own food, and would not be contributing to the environmental and ethical factors that cause concern in animal agriculture, but sadly, domesticated animals like cats, are dependant on us for everything that is important in their lives, including food. Unfortunately, this means we would need to provide our cats with a source of animal based protein to keep them healthy. The small consolation we take here, is in the fact that most cat and dog foods do not come from animals being slaughtered to feed cats and dogs, but rather from by-products from animals being killed to feed people (i.e. made from animal proteins which are not allowed to be sold as human ‘food’). 
We know that vegan cat foods are being developed, but we don't believe that there is one on the market at this time has been proven to keep cats healthy and happy. If an option like this does become available we will be open to considering it, if it is locally available and proven (without doubt) to be sufficient for cat's health.
This is something that we’ve tackled with personally and as a business. The issue is, PlantLife will be situated on an island in the gulf of Thailand, Koh Phangan - being able to ship potentially viable vegan cat food hundreds of miles across multiple transportation is not sustainable. Currently, the closest supplier is Singapore, but the product testing and customer feedback that we’ve read through extensively, doesn’t make this a product that we would be happy to feed our animals.

 
Imagine arriving at a lush, luxury paradise on a beautiful tropical island....
... You’re welcomed by a warm and friendly team and handed a chilled lemongrass tea and a fragrant warm towel to refresh you after your long journey.
... Imagine the sweet smell of jasmine and orchids whilst you enjoy the plush, authentic and traditional surroundings. You notice the low hum of a therapeutic pur radiating from a small, furry cat curled up on a colourful woven cushion beside you; greeting you like an old friend into their safe haven. Imagine walking the path through the abundant and vibrant hotel grounds, you approach your villa and pluck a fresh and juicy rose apple from a tree at your doorstep. You enter what will be your home for the next few days and notice the soaps, the lotions, the furnishings, even the dressing gowns and beach bags in your room are ethical and vegan. You enjoy the cool air; a welcome refuge from the warm morning sun. Imagine knowing that you can enjoy the refreshing, cool air and warm water from a rainfall shower worry-free, because this hotel runs entirely on solar energy and renewable water sources.
... Imagine wandering to the restaurant with a rumbling tummy, knowing that whatever you order will be completely guilt-free in more ways than one; nutritious, delicious and cruelty-free. You wander through lush palm and fruit trees and spy a fluffy clowder of kittens warming themselves in a patch of sun under a flowering banana tree.
...Imagine being accompanied to the hidden botanical library cafe by a wise & peaceful soi dog, after enjoying a refreshing dip in the luxurious, chemical-free swimming pool.
... Imagine sinking into your soft bed after an evening under the stars and fairy lights, watching your favourite movie in the company of kind, like-minded people and PlantLife’s furry residents. You relax further into your bed and think about your long day exploring this heaven that you have been excited about for so long.
... Imagine just before you close your eyes to rest, you look across the room and see a small bundle curled up in a Thai wicker basket; your new friend on your first day at PlantLife.
 
Risks & Challenges

What happens if we don't reach our target? Rest assured, if we don't reach our target your money will be refunded. If this happens, then sure, that would suck, BUT it wouldn't necessarily be the end of PlantLife... The more you share this video and campaign and the more we can show some tangible numbers demonstrating how interested we know you guys will be in a hotel like this, then the easier it will be for us to attain funding from other sources such as VCs if necessary. 
 

Implementing solar power will be difficult won't it? To properly implement solar panels in the most effective way, it is a great idea to integrate them into the build rather than add them later, which is what we are doing. However, not all construction companies know how to do this effectively. This is why we have Phangan Solar on board to help advise us on things such as effective insulation, which will help us down the line to ensure we do not waste any power and how to properly integrate the solar panels into the hotel build. The electricity grid on Koh Phangan is pretty temperamental, so solar will be quite a reliable power source in comparison, considering the consistency of sunny days in Thailand. We will also have batteries to store solar power for use throughout the night. However, in the unlikely scenario that the batteries run out, we will have back up power. 
 

Isn't Koh Phangan a party island? Yes and No. Koh Phangan was first inhabited by Monks who were impressed by the island's spiritual energy. This sparked the beginning of the spiritual community who live by kind and gentle practices such as ahimsa, which is the concept of non-violence towards other humans, animals and the land. This community is now predominantly on the West side of the island where many vegan cafes and yoga retreats are situated (and where PlantLife will be built). This community began the respectful, spiritual and ceremonial celebration of the full moon on Koh Phangan. In recent years, however, Full Moon Parties have been come to be known as something very different. These parties mostly take place on the South East of the island in Haad Rin. Although this presents itself as a threat, and despite, unfortunately, being disruptive to the South East of the island, these parties are not a threat to the peaceful West side of the island. Koh Phangan has its own strict zoning system in place to protect the island and ensure these party areas do not grow. In fact, the disruptive nature of these parties is actually prompting the Thai authorities to implement more and more measures to help conserve the environment and communities on Koh Phangan and have, for example, recently banned ‘unfriendly activities’, such as fishing, fish feeding, anchoring on coral reefs, construction on the beach, and walking on the seabed on the islands (implemented in July 2018). So yes, there are full moon parties on Koh Phangan (on the other side of the island), but we are confident that, as travellers are becoming more conscious and authorities are becoming stricter with disruptive tourism, that these parties will become less and less over time, leaving Koh Phangan a relatively untouched, unspoilt and quiet island with many eco practices. 
 

Why is the resort not on the beach? We believe being situated a short distance from the beach will allow us to achieve a secluded paradise oasis. The majority of beach areas have at least some population, therefore factors such as noise pollution, potential litter, already occupied beaches and music from restaurants and hotels will be totally out of our control in these areas. This secluded piece of land gives us an opportunity to create a completely peaceful, spacious and secluded environment. But, don't worry! We know that a holiday isn't a holiday without the ocean, so we will be providing free shuttles (7 minute ride) to Srithanu beach (aka Zen beach) 3-4 times daily and bicycle hire will be available if you would rather a short cycle.
 

But you don't have experience in building hotels...  It is true that neither of us have experience in building or managing a hotel. However, our travels have given us extensive and valuable insight into what makes a memorable and remarkable hotel. We know that we are exactly our target audience, which puts us in the unique position of knowing exactly what our guests want. Many hotel operators or developers do not have this insight; we believe this is why many hotels fail to be personable, responsible and memorable. However, we know that there are many inner workings of a hotel build and operation that we will need help with. This is why we are hiring a strong and passionate team to help us develop, build & operate PlantLife.
 

What if I don't like animals? The emphasis at PlantLife will be that our guests are never forced to interact with the animals, if they do not choose to, and vice versa. The smart architecture of the whole resort will be designed around the animals. The animals will have nooks, hideaways and beds all over the resort, so guests can choose to interact with the animals when and if they like. We will also have an ‘animal & guest lounge area’, where both animals and guests can relax together on hammocks, daybeds and furnishings if they want to. The interior will be carefully designed to create a luxury, cohabit space for both guests and resident animals. The guests will not be obliged to, but will have the option to invite the animals into their rooms during the day or night to enjoy the space together. Villas will utilize smart architecture to integrate the animals and facilitate guest interaction. The animals will not be trapped in any place where they are forced to interact (like many cat cafes), so there is no forced interaction both ways.  
 

But I'm not vegan... Don't worry, our menu has so much variety and lots of plant based meat, so you won't even know the difference; you might even feel healthier by the end of your stay, which is an unusual bonus at the end of a luxury holiday!   
 

What if Im allergic to cats or dogs?! Fear not! 2 of our villas will be designated for guests with dander allergies. They will be dander free zones!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some people just can't contribute, but there are still ways you can help! 
Share share share! Let's make some noise with this campaign. The more you share, the more chance there is of PlantLife becoming a reality, whether we make our target or not. Sharing our campaign on social media or even by word of mouth will go a long way to helping us reach our goal. 
Want to donate more or get your hands on a bigger piece of the vegan pie? Please contact us at info@plantlifehotel.comwww.plantlifehotel.comhttps://www.instagram.com/plantlifehotel/http://www.facebook.com/plantlifehotelhttps://twitter.com/PlantLifeHotel

story:
The wait is over. Drone lovers and tech enthusiasts now have the chance to personalize and assemble their very own 3D-printed, modular drone. The Mosquito, from BonaDrone, is an easy-to-fly and customizable smart quadcopter. It also happens to be the product of two of the most exciting innovations in technology right now: Drones and 3D Printing.

Our mission is simple. We want to give everyone the opportunity to design and build their own unqiue, 3D-printed drone through our platform. We’ve done the hard work, it’s down to you to decide what the final result will look like and your drone’s functionalities.

While we are happy to send your final Mosquito fully set up and ready to fly, we encourage our users to receive their drones in pieces. We think this is a great way to give everyone the chance to learn about how drones work and discover the technology behind what we do. As well as being customizable and 3D-printed, the Mosquito also comes with a range of autonomous flight features and the promise that we will be there to guide you on your journey, every step of the way.




The BonaDrone experience begins with a basic product, the “Mosquito”. From this platform you can personalize, assemble and take apart your drone. You can improve and upgrade it, or adapt it to perform a specific task to suit your needs and preferences. Design your drone in 3 easy steps:

First up you have to customize the appearance of the Mosquito. This involves selecting the colors for every part of the drone, including the logo on the top cover.  

Second, choose from a range of accessories to give your drone a specific functionality; if you want a drone for photography, choose the gimbal, if you want it to carry something, add on our hook. These accessories are easily interchangeable. Eventually we hope to extend the amount of accessories available to our customers after our (hopefully!) successful IndieGoGo campaign. But, to give you an idea, the next potential things we have in mind are a FPV kit and arms kitted out with LED lights. The possibilities really are endless.

Finally all of our users can decide if they want to improve the performance of their Mosquito drone. This can be done by replacing part of the frame with carbon fiber, upgrading the flight controller or upgrading from a 4 propeller drone (Quadcopter) to an 8 propeller drone (Octocopter).

At BonaDrone, we will always be on hand to support our users, and care deeply about building the foundations for a strong community, not just a great drone. That is why all of our products will be delivered with a complete assembly and electronic connections manual. Moreover we have an address, support@bonadrone.com, and a skype channel, BonaDrone Support, which will offer useful resources and be clear points of contact.

BonaDrone fuses two innovative and exciting technologies: drones and 3D printing. We want to spread the latest in innovation to as wide an audience as possible, and feel that the best way to do this is through our Mosquito drone. All in all we provide an immersive, enjoyable way for people to customize and build their very own drone, offering step by step guidance along the way. Anybody can follow our simple instructions, configure their own drone and, most importantly, fly!

We offer personalizations and improvements to push the limits of your creativity. We also encourage community members to suggest proposals and designs for future features and products. You can share your ideas with us at www.bonadrone.com/suggestion , and we will put the most popular into production after a vote from our users.

Thanks to a system that allows users to assemble and disassemble accessories easily, any new ones we develop will be completely interchangeable. Exciting possibilities are opening up in front of us all the time, and we hope that the Mosquito drone will contribute greatly to the DIY drone community and grow alongside it.

* Depending on the country, there may be an extra charge for customs

So how did it all happen? Well, just one year ago, a group of friends began to develop the idea of a personalized drone based on a DIY concept. It had to have great performance to compete with the industry’s finest, but it also needed to be easy to assemble and customizable. Over the following months, and with the help of advances in 3D printing, the Mosquito, our new DIY Drone, started to take shape.

BonaDrone consists of the following members:

  • Pep Martí Saumell: Industrial engineer, 5 years of working experience as Industrial product designer. Passionate of 3D printing and its the multiple applications. Responsible of the design and the development of the Mosquito.
  • Josep Tomàs Vergés: Industrial engineer, 4 years working experience as project manager coordinating production, transport, assembly and commissioning. Starting flirting with drones 2 years ago. Responsible of the commercial and logistics issues.
  • Daniel López Hidalgo: Informatic engineer, more than 6 years of experience in web & software development. Responsible of drone controller settings and intern software.
  • Alex Cazorla Solà: Informatic engineer, more than 6 years of experience in web & applications development. In charge of the website development and marketing.
  • Jordi Grau Boladeras: Electronic assembly technician, more than 8 years working as electronic technician of petrol stations. In charge of the production and assembly process and the quality control.

The idea of BonaDrone was born at an airport in Germany, where Pep and Alex were visiting Josep, who was doing his Erasmus in Berlin. Later Dani and Jordi joined the team, and nowadays BonaDrone is a group effort between 5 childhood friends- each with expetise in either engineering or IT.

We are based in a small town near Barcelona, Spain. From there we have decided to start this exciting new project combining 3D printing and drones; two technologies that stand to revolutionize our daily lives in the coming years.

Our first step was to buy spare parts, assemble a drone and discover the electronic components required. With this first drone we started to understand how it worked and what was necessary to make it fly. Unfortunately the result was a drone that was pretty difficult to pilot and downright ugly. We named it “Frankenstein”.

After plenty of reflection and countless hours of investigation, we concluded that we were not the only ones who were trying to create our own drone from scratch. Instead we decided to use our skills and knowledge to start creating our first drone through 3D printing.

The final product that you see above is the result of a long journey full of doubts, struggles and lessons learned.

And therein lies the real motivation behind this project. We want to offer a pack that can help anybody design, assemble and fly their very own drone - but with high performance at the first time of asking. We’ve experienced Frankenstein already, and nobody needs to go through that again. We have already been in the position of every ambitious user, and want to make the whole process way easier for those who decide to join this wonderful world of drones and 3D printing.

After implementing some modifications with our first prototype, we are proud to be left with the product which is the foundation of our idea, the “Mosquito”. From this basis, any user will be available to assemble a unique drone on our platform.

That is how the Mosquito and the idea of our DIY Drone project was born. Welcome to the BonaDrone philosophy.



Since its creation, the Mosquito has been piloted by many different people, from children to teenagers, grandparents and even a helicopter pilot. Everybody has enjoyed discovering the latest trend in technology and witnessing what can be done with a 3D printer. As the “Mosquito” takes to the sky it lets the imagination fly too; just imagine all of the future possibilities!

If you like the world of technology, you will love the Mosquito. Our dream is to inspire people’s creativity and let our users influence the design by adapting and assembling the Mosquito. We want people to learn all about this new technology, and discover the endless possibilities of the drone revolution.

Finally, we would like to thank you for taking the time to visit the BonaDrone’s project. We hope that you will back us and spread the word!

As with any  technological product with complex characteristics, there is a risk that users will struggle to piece things together. In order to avoid that, on top of our channels of support available, we have developed easy-to-use manuals, as well as tutorial videos that will be shared with our backers.

As engineers we are aware of the challenges that come with any new idea in the world of drones. Because of this we want to grow the DIY Drone community and lead the way in accessible starter packs.

We have many ideas ready to be developed but first we need to find out if our ideahas a place on the current market. A good barometer of this will be the result of ourIndiegogo campaign. So if you want us to stick around, your support would be greatly appreciated!

3D printing is certainly suitable for small-ish productionprojects, but it will be a challenge for us to develop a comprehensive manufacturing structure around this technology. Others technologies do exist which would allow us better manufacturing performance,  but we believe in the ever-growing 3D printing world and are happy to back it.

It is a technology which offers incredible flexibility, amazing shapes and personalizedparts  perfect for drones.  The best part is that 3D printing is still in the early stages. This means that early adopters such as ourselves are ready to ride the wave stake our claim in this market space.

How to contact us?
You can contact through support@bonadrone.com

How do I pledge?

To pledge to our project, first make sure that you're logged in to your Indiegogo account. Then, just select your perk.

What forms of payment can I use to make a pledge?  
You can use any type of payment because you will pay through PayPal.

When is my card charged?
If the project you’re backing is successfully funded, your card will be charged when the project reaches its funding deadline. If the project does not reach its funding goal, your card is never charged.If you've backed a project that is still live and are seeing a charge on your bank statement, what you are likely seeing is a temporary authorization of funds. The time it takes for an authorization to clear varies on the bank, but typically takes 1 - 3 days. You will not be charged until the project you backed has ended successfully.

Which is the average fly time?
The Mosquito can fly for between 15 and 20 minutes, depending on the pilot, the weather conditions and the weight of the drone.

Do you need some experience to pilot the Mosquito?
No, someone who has never piloted a drone is capable of flying the Mosquito. Currently we do some tests with people from different ages and everyone has piloted it without problems. But as always, practice makes perfect!

If my drone has an accident is it easy to repair?
One of the strengths of BonaDrone is that everyone can assemble and disassemble their drone easily. If your drone crashes and you damage a certain part, you can repair it in a few minutes!

Will it be possible to replace 3D printed parts for another material?
Yes, the user could get the carbon fiber kit and change some 3D parts of the Mosquito for the carbon fiber. With tha, the Mosquito will be lighter and more customizable.

Will there be Mosquito upgrades?
Yes, BonaDrone uses the Mosquito as a base of every update or upgrade so you do not need to buy another product.

Which are the advantages of the Mosquito?
The customization possibilities are infinite. You could imagine any utility for your drone because with Mosquito and BonaDrone it could be possible. Also, if the drone crashes, it should be fairly simple to repair by yourself for a small price, providing you can find the broken part! This makes a big change from other drones which are fully assembled and have to be replaced, not repaired.

Could I use other electronic components instead of the standard ones?
The Mosquito is designed with our standard electronic components in mind, but yes, modification is easily possible.

Why 3D printing?
3D printing offers limitless customization possibilities, and so we started working with this technology because we thought it would appeal to the most users. Moreover the material properties are good enough to build a drone, since they are strong enough but incredibly light.

Can the Mosquito be controlled from a Smartphone?
Yes, you can control the Mosquito from a Smartphone through an open source App(Tower) developed by 3DRobotics.

In the future, could I print the parts by myself?
Yes, we're working to make that possible.
story_txt:
The wait is over. Drone lovers and tech enthusiasts now have the chance to personalize and assemble their very own 3D-printed, modular drone. The Mosquito, from BonaDrone, is an easy-to-fly and customizable smart quadcopter. It also happens to be the product of two of the most exciting innovations in technology right now: Drones and 3D Printing.
Our mission is simple. We want to give everyone the opportunity to design and build their own unqiue, 3D-printed drone through our platform. We’ve done the hard work, it’s down to you to decide what the final result will look like and your drone’s functionalities.While we are happy to send your final Mosquito fully set up and ready to fly, we encourage our users to receive their drones in pieces. We think this is a great way to give everyone the chance to learn about how drones work and discover the technology behind what we do. As well as being customizable and 3D-printed, the Mosquito also comes with a range of autonomous flight features and the promise that we will be there to guide you on your journey, every step of the way.
























The BonaDrone experience begins with a basic product, the “Mosquito”. From this platform you can personalize, assemble and take apart your drone. You can improve and upgrade it, or adapt it to perform a specific task to suit your needs and preferences. Design your drone in 3 easy steps:








First up you have to customize the appearance of the Mosquito. This involves selecting the colors for every part of the drone, including the logo on the top cover.  








Second, choose from a range of accessories to give your drone a specific functionality; if you want a drone for photography, choose the gimbal, if you want it to carry something, add on our hook. These accessories are easily interchangeable. Eventually we hope to extend the amount of accessories available to our customers after our (hopefully!) successful IndieGoGo campaign. But, to give you an idea, the next potential things we have in mind are a FPV kit and arms kitted out with LED lights. The possibilities really are endless.







Finally all of our users can decide if they want to improve the performance of their Mosquito drone. This can be done by replacing part of the frame with carbon fiber, upgrading the flight controller or upgrading from a 4 propeller drone (Quadcopter) to an 8 propeller drone (Octocopter). 









At BonaDrone, we will always be on hand to support our users, and care deeply about building the foundations for a strong community, not just a great drone. That is why all of our products will be delivered with a complete assembly and electronic connections manual. Moreover we have an address, support@bonadrone.com, and a skype channel, BonaDrone Support, which will offer useful resources and be clear points of contact. 







BonaDrone fuses two innovative and exciting technologies: drones and 3D printing. We want to spread the latest in innovation to as wide an audience as possible, and feel that the best way to do this is through our Mosquito drone. All in all we provide an immersive, enjoyable way for people to customize and build their very own drone, offering step by step guidance along the way. Anybody can follow our simple instructions, configure their own drone and, most importantly, fly!




We offer personalizations and improvements to push the limits of your creativity. We also encourage community members to suggest proposals and designs for future features and products. You can share your ideas with us at www.bonadrone.com/suggestion , and we will put the most popular into production after a vote from our users. 
Thanks to a system that allows users to assemble and disassemble accessories easily, any new ones we develop will be completely interchangeable. Exciting possibilities are opening up in front of us all the time, and we hope that the Mosquito drone will contribute greatly to the DIY drone community and grow alongside it.




















 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

* Depending on the country, there may be an extra charge for customs




So how did it all happen? Well, just one year ago, a group of 
friends began to develop the idea of a personalized drone based on a DIY
 concept. It had to have great performance to compete with the 
industry’s finest, but it also needed to be easy to assemble and 
customizable. Over the following months, and with the help of advances 
in 3D printing, the Mosquito, our new DIY Drone, started to take shape.





BonaDrone consists of the following members:



Pep Martí Saumell: Industrial engineer, 5 years of working experience as Industrial product designer. Passionate of 3D printing and its the multiple applications. Responsible of the design and the development of the Mosquito.


Josep Tomàs Vergés: Industrial engineer, 4 years working experience as project manager coordinating production, transport, assembly and commissioning. Starting flirting with drones 2 years ago. Responsible of the commercial and logistics issues.

Daniel López Hidalgo: Informatic engineer, more than 6 years of experience in web & software development.  Responsible of drone controller settings and intern software.

Alex Cazorla Solà: Informatic engineer, more than 6 years of experience in web & applications development. In charge of the website development and marketing.

Jordi Grau Boladeras: Electronic assembly technician, more than 8 years working as electronic technician of petrol stations. In charge of the production and assembly process and the quality control.


The idea of BonaDrone was born at an airport in Germany, where Pep and Alex were visiting Josep, who was doing his Erasmus in Berlin. Later Dani and Jordi joined the team, and nowadays BonaDrone is a group effort between 5 childhood friends- each with expetise in either engineering or IT.
We are based in a small town near Barcelona, Spain. From there we have decided to start this exciting new project combining 3D printing and drones; two technologies that stand to revolutionize our daily lives in the coming years. 
Our first step was to buy spare parts, assemble a drone and discover the electronic components required. With this first drone we started to understand how it worked and what was necessary to make it fly. Unfortunately the result was a drone that was pretty difficult to pilot and downright ugly. We named it “Frankenstein”. After plenty of reflection and countless hours of investigation, we concluded that we were not the only ones who were trying to create our own drone from scratch. Instead we decided to use our skills and knowledge to start creating our first drone through 3D printing.



The final product that you see above is the result of a long journey full of doubts, struggles and lessons learned. 
And therein lies the real motivation behind this project. We want to offer a pack that can help anybody design, assemble and fly their very own drone - but with high performance at the first time of asking. We’ve experienced Frankenstein already, and nobody needs to go through that again. We have already been in the position of every ambitious user, and want to make the whole process way easier for those who decide to join this wonderful world of drones and 3D printing.
After implementing some modifications with our first prototype, we are proud to be left with the product which is the foundation of our idea, the “Mosquito”. From this basis, any user will be available to assemble a unique drone on our platform.That is how the Mosquito and the idea of our DIY Drone project was born. Welcome to the BonaDrone philosophy.

































Since its creation, the Mosquito has been piloted by many different people, from children to teenagers, grandparents and even a helicopter pilot. Everybody has enjoyed discovering the latest trend in technology and witnessing what can be done with a 3D printer. As the “Mosquito” takes to the sky it lets the imagination fly too; just imagine all of the future possibilities!





If you like the world of technology, you will love the Mosquito. Our dream is to inspire people’s creativity and let our users influence the design by adapting and assembling the Mosquito. We want people to learn all about this new technology, and discover the endless possibilities of the drone revolution. 





Finally, we would like to thank you for taking the time to visit the BonaDrone’s project. We hope that you will back us and spread the word!











As with any  technological product with complex characteristics, there is a risk that users will struggle to piece things together. In order to avoid that, on top of our channels of support available, we have developed easy-to-use manuals, as well as tutorial videos that will be shared with our backers.





As engineers we are aware of the challenges that come with any new idea in the world of drones. Because of this we want to grow the DIY Drone community and lead the way in accessible starter packs. We have many ideas ready to be developed but first we need to find out if our ideahas a place on the current market. A good barometer of this will be the result of ourIndiegogo campaign. So if you want us to stick around, your support would be greatly appreciated!




3D printing is certainly suitable for small-ish productionprojects, but it will be a challenge for us to develop a comprehensive manufacturing structure around this technology. Others technologies do exist which would allow us better manufacturing performance,  but we believe in the ever-growing 3D printing world and are happy to back it.It is a technology which offers incredible flexibility, amazing shapes and personalizedparts  perfect for drones.  The best part is that 3D printing is still in the early stages. This means that early adopters such as ourselves are ready to ride the wave stake our claim in this market space. 



How to contact us?You can contact through support@bonadrone.comHow do I pledge?To pledge to our project, first make sure that you're logged in to your Indiegogo account. Then, just select your perk.

What forms of payment can I use to make a pledge?  
You can use any type of payment because you will pay through PayPal.
When is my card charged?
If the project you’re backing is successfully funded, your card will be charged when the project reaches its funding deadline. If the project does not reach its funding goal, your card is never charged.If you've backed a project that is still live and are seeing a charge on your bank statement, what you are likely seeing is a temporary authorization of funds. The time it takes for an authorization to clear varies on the bank, but typically takes 1 - 3 days. You will not be charged until the project you backed has ended successfully.
Which is the average fly time?
The Mosquito can fly for between 15 and 20 minutes, depending on the pilot, the weather conditions and the weight of the drone.
Do you need some experience to pilot the Mosquito?
No, someone who has never piloted a drone is capable of flying the Mosquito. Currently we do some tests with people from different ages and everyone has piloted it without problems. But as always, practice makes perfect!
If my drone has an accident is it easy to repair?
One of the strengths of BonaDrone is that everyone can assemble and disassemble their drone easily. If your drone crashes and you damage a certain part, you can repair it in a few minutes!
Will it be possible to replace 3D printed parts for another material?
Yes, the user could get the carbon fiber kit and change some 3D parts of the Mosquito for the carbon fiber. With tha, the Mosquito will be lighter and more customizable.
Will there be Mosquito upgrades?
Yes, BonaDrone uses the Mosquito as a base of every update or upgrade so you do not need to buy another product.
Which are the advantages of the Mosquito?
The customization possibilities are infinite. You could imagine any utility for your drone because with Mosquito and BonaDrone it could be possible. Also, if the drone crashes, it should be fairly simple to repair by yourself for a small price, providing you can find the broken part! This makes a big change from other drones which are fully assembled and have to be replaced, not repaired.
Could I use other electronic components instead of the standard ones?
The Mosquito is designed with our standard electronic components in mind, but yes, modification is easily possible.
Why 3D printing?
3D printing offers limitless customization possibilities, and so we started working with this technology because we thought it would appeal to the most users. Moreover the material properties are good enough to build a drone, since they are strong enough but incredibly light.
Can the Mosquito be controlled from a Smartphone?Yes, you can control the Mosquito from a Smartphone through an open source App(Tower) developed by 3DRobotics.
In the future, could I print the parts by myself?
Yes, we're working to make that possible.

story:
The next revolution in mountain biking

Meet the WhiteCrow Hub, your new tire pressure adjusting hub that allows you to deflate and inflate your tire while you ride and as often as you like.

Founder Xavier Serret thought of a breakthrough solution to the longtime wish of mountain bike riders to make tire pressure adjustment easy and practical without having to stop.

The WhiteCrow Hub is fully mechanical and based on a closed-air concept that prevents external air from being sucked in from a potentially dirty environment. When deflating, air is stored in a reservoir where the pressure is higher than the air in the tire. This makes tire re-inflating effortless, fast and very clean. 

 

The Buzz

“This is a very interesting project. It’s something we at Ibis have been thinking about for a long time. Glad to see someone is trying it.”

-- Scot Nicol, Founder

 

“Just imagine using that in a race, how applicable it can be!”

“Bottom line is, this will allow you to run even lower pressures and not bottom the tire out, just not even using the inner chamber to save your rim... I’d be really interested to see how this one works out. I think it could end up being in a really cool situation.”

 

“The one Iditarod veteran we mentioned the hub to was extremely excited about the idea and hustled over to take a look- so White Crow may well find itself a hungry market.”

 

“Besides just getting lower pressures and the associated improvement in comfort and traction, the WhiteCrow system has other side benefits. The inner air reservoir goes a long way to preventing tubeless burping, and also protects the rim from obstacle impacts and pinch flats. That also means you can ride much thinner (read: lighter) rims on more technical trails. The setup also makes it easier to mount non-tubeless tires and rims tubeless because of the added security.”

“The WhiteCrow air pressure regulation system was developed in Belgium, and is said to be able to stand up to muddy and wet conditions. That’s good, because foul weather is probably where this type of a system would really shine.”

 

 

“As a competitive Fat Bike racer I need every advantage I can get. Often during races the snow conditions on the trail change and as little as a 1/2 psi tire pressure adjustment can make the difference between winning and losing. Having the ability to adjust tire pressures while on the bike keeps me moving efficiently and the WhiteCrow Hub is a promising approach.”

-- Gabe Klamer, Winner of 200km Fat Pursuit 2016

 

“Fat Bikes are great fun, they can ride everywhere and they provide a lower rolling resistance than narrow tires, if they are set to the appropriate tire pressure. But that’s the main issue! Stepping off the bike to adjust tire pressure takes too much time.  A system that would allow me to adjust the pressure on the fly would be great and I would prefer WhiteCrow’s mechanical solution. That way you can just pick your bike for a ride instead of worry about an empty battery or CO2 canister!”

-- Arnout Matthys, First biker on one leg to finish 650km Crocodile Trophy

 

“Impressive!!! This looks amazing. We are very much looking forward installing the WhiteCrow Hub on our Fat Bikes!!!”

-- David Espallargas, Founder

 

 

Why is this Revolutionary?

A genius idea: an air-closed fully mechanical design, enabling almost instantaneous tire inflation in any situation. No refills nor batteries needed!

Tire Inflation

 
Tire inflation is very simply achieved by releasing air from the high-pressure air reservoir into the tire. The WhiteCrow Hub has a simple bypass valve enabling this. This process is totally effortless and quick.

 

Tire deflation

 

This is where the magic happens:  the Air Pump is used to deflate the tire!

Tire deflation is achieved by compressing air from the tire into the reservoir. Inside the WhiteCrow Hub, a relatively large air compressor is driven by the wheel rotation itself (the Air Pump).

 

Advantages of in-tire air reservoir

  • It prevents tubeless-ready burping.
  • It protects the rim from nasty knocks when the tire pressure is very low.
  • It allows for efficient rolling as there is no contact between the inner surface of the tire and the reservoir (except when you hit something hard, see above point).
  • Finally, weight is saved allowing the use of ultra-thin rims when this would normally be too risky.

 

Integration of the WhiteCrow Hub
on your bike

 

 

Specifications

Bike Integration

Back Wheel

  • 170QR
  • 12 mm through axle 177, 197
  • Boost 148
  • Shimano 10s & 11s
  • SRAM 11s & 12s (XD)

Disc Brakes

  • 6-hole standard

Handlebar command

  • WhiteCrow Remote (left & right mount)

Command cable

  • Standard shifting cable

Disc-side

  • Bottom or top routing back wheel

Tires

  • Whatever you like, tubeless-ready.
  • Inner chamber Protects high-tpi thin-walled tires.

Rims

  • Any with 32 spokes (extra valve hole required at ~ 165 degrees opposite standard valve hole),
  • Inner chamber protects light-weight rims from impact.

 

Performance

Tire pressure regulation

  • Min pressure user defined at start of each ride.
  • Pressure regulation range: 15 psi  (1 Bar) typical
  • Max pressure: Min Pressure + Range (obviously)
  • Regulation cycles: unlimited
  • Regulation steps: end-user modulable

Weight

  • WhiteCrow Hub ~ 350 grs over typical hub (of which ~150 grs is non-rotating mass)
  • In-tire chamber ~ 200 grs (yet enables mounting thin-walled & light tires, which results in reduced rolling resistance for the similar overall weight)

Over 130 Freewheel engagement points

  • Less than 2.70 deg !
  •  Engineered for unique sound

Construction and wheel strength

  • Main hub body parts in USA-made 7075-T6 aluminum hard-anodized
  • Central hub body in Carbon Fiber, multi-directional pre-preg
  • Enduro bearings
  • 32 spokes in an “ultra-wide triangle” enable extra-strong wheel construction in with light-weight short spokes

 

 

 

The magic inside the WhiteCrow Hub

Our hub is an engineering marvel and is probably the most audacious piece of technology introduced into mountain biking since the times of the first oleo-pneumatic forks. Moreover, while the first suspensions and disc brakes were “ports” of technologies initially developed for motorcycling, our hub is genuinely brand new kit specifically designed for mountain biking.

 

 

Our greatest engineering challenge, the Air Pump has no pistons but only two mechanically-actuated parts (with a core eccentric that translates rather than rotate). This allows for an all-temperature range as well as an ultra-light all-polymer design. Moreover, when the pump’s not in use it doesn’t generate any parasitic drag. 

 

THE COMMAND CLUTCH

The clutch is controlled from the handlebar via a standard shifter cable routed along the bike’s frame and through the center axle of the wheel. It has three positions:

1. Inflation: Air Inflation through air release valve (Tire Inflation Valve).

2. Mid Rest: Nothing happens here, just keep riding as usual. 

3. Deflation: Torque-modulated air-inflation through Air Pump actuation.

 

THE HUB BODY

The lightweight oversized design with large flanges allows for building ultra-strong wheels. In 7075 T6 aluminum and light weight carbon fiber, the body is also designed for an optimized all-weather-proof (living in Belgium, we know what extensive mud damage looks like!).

 

THE FREEWHEEL

To be released in both Shimano 11x and SRAM XD versions, it provides over 130 engagement points… Nice, isn’t it?!

 

WHAT ELSE?

Obviously, we’ve designed our hub for easy maintenance. We’ve also included safety features to easily overcome any problems during your ride.

 

Very frequently asked questions (VFAQ)

1) But…how much does it weigh?

The number 1 question everyone asked.

We are not yet disclosing our concrete weight data until our final engineering for production is complete. What we can say is that we are on target for the hub of a delta weight of 350 g (12.35 oz) over typical OEM hub (what you get on your new bike). For the air-reservoir on the rim, it’s ~200 g (7oz) more.

So, it’s heavier than your current hub… yet before you stop reading, just consider first that on a bike we are all first concerned about added weight because:

  1. It increases the amount of energy we need to put when pedaling.
  2. It makes the wheel feel more sluggish due to increased moment of inertia.

For 1, it doesn’t take long to realize that a mountain bike is much slower in pavement than a road bike not because it’s heavier, but because it has a much larger rolling resistance! Strap yourself an 8 lbs backpack when road biking and you can try testing this going uphill, straight or down.

So for mountain biking, rolling resistance is a major factor to your energy expenditure, and the amount of energy “wasted” by a tire at the wrong pressure can be really significant, easily over 15% on large tire. Remember this happens while climbing, rolling over flats and even downhill!  So in a typical ride, with our Hub you will end up spending less energy overall! 

For 2, most of the added weight is in the center of the wheel, of which ~ 150 g are non-rotating mass.  Then the air-reservoir is actually supporting tire at low pressure and also providing a very strong shock protection to the rim.  This enables you to mount lighter, more efficient tires and also light but delicate rims.  A fully optimized wheel has a similar moment of inertia but with lower rolling resistance.

 

2) Why does it cost so much?

Because it is very costly to manufacture...

Well, making a very large but still light-weight hub that can withstand all the punishment mountain biking can inflict requires the use only the best materials and processes available. The main structure of the hub that you can see is fully collaborated with European CNC partners (with USA negotiations underway). It’s not just made of your average 7075-T6 Aluminum (which is made in China. Oops!) but also it’s sourced from the most reputable USA providers. Similarly for the carbon fiber hub-body and the rest of the stuff that one cannot see from the outside.  

 

3) And… are there other advantages to the WhiteCrow Hub beyond tire pressure regulation?

Yes, the oversized nature of the hub allows us to build wheels with shorter spokes in a wide “cantilever”. This results in much stiffer wheels, which are more energy efficient and handle better in rough terrain.  Note how SRAM highlights this feature in its new Boost standard; we do Boost and much better still!  

Also, the freewheel has over 130 engagement points (or less than 2.7 deg), this provides a very “tight” feeling with a practically-immediate return of pedaling power to get you out of any tricky situation.  Go ahead and check the internet to see how many competitors do better than us!

 

 

Awesome benefits

 

The journey - We need you Now!

Late 2013 --Initial idea under the shower after a night-ride across a muddy Belgian forest.

Feb 2014 -- First Patent Application.

March 2014 -- First engineering studies.  Industrial engineer Mathijs Verstraete joins, followed by bike wheel expert Rob Bruyndonckx. 1st iteration project starts in collaboration with the multidisciplinary industry research lab “Sirris” resulting in a complete conceptual mockup of the design.

Oct 2014 -- WhiteCrow Tech SA established.

Dec 2015 -- Award-winning industrial designer Etienne Brandt joins the team. Funds for further engineering and prototyping secured from reputable startup investor, The Faktory. 

Jan 2016 --  Enlisting of VKC, an experienced materials laboratory specialized in the automotive industry, and continued collaboration with Sirris and other selected engineers.

June 2016 -- Field tests of WhiteCrow Hub start. Our field tests include all types of terrain,  bikes ridden by strong riders.

June - Nov 2016 --  Large amount of prototype iterations to develop and test all the brand-new internal active elements of the hub. At this point we have used all the kinds of CNC, molding & advanced 3D printing prototyping technologies available in Europe.

Dec 2016 -- All internal active tire-pressure regulation components work and assembly architecture demonstrated.

Jan 2017 -- Crowdfunding campaign

We are small team, this Indediegogo campaign is the key enabling us to move this truly brand new technology towards production.

Your support is of utmost importance to jumpstart a fresh journey in mountain bike innovations.

Jan - March 2007 - More lab R&D to optimize the internal pump construction, Extensive all-weather field testing.

April 2017 - First public field tests of the hub available to the press. Ramp up for pre-production.

June 2017 -- Projected shipping of the first batch to crowdfunding participants

Sept 2017 -- Projected shipping of regular production

 

The rewards

 

 

A team of bike enthusiasts

   

Xavier Serret, WhiteCrow Tech Founder 

An insatiable bike rider, a multidisciplinary engineer, an inventor and a tenacious entrepreneur, Xavier held C-level positions at fintech companies such as InsuCom and FinMetrics and is also the owner of several patents in the domains of data authentication, encoding and protection since 2004.

 

Etienne Brandt, Award-winning industrial designer

Boasting an Academy Award (Oscar) for technical achievement on his pioneering work on high-end drones, Etienne is also a fanatic in all things with 2 wheels and no engine.

 

Rob Bruyndonckx, Wheel building Expert, Founder of Swooth

Rob is a Belgian master wheel builder collaborating with the international competition team of GT, the European team of Kona and many others.

 

Mathijs Verstraete, Industrial Engineer

A product and application engineer, Mathijs has written many publications and is a professional in automotive air filtration, acoustics and creative concept development. He is, of course, another fanatic mountain biker.                 

 

A token for our seed investor

WhiteCrow Tech has been accepted as the 2015 batch of The Faktory - a private tech startup accelerator and seed investment fund founded by Pierre L’Hoest, the Belgian entrepreneur known for his TV slow motion technology company, EVS (Market Capital of 443,1M€ as of 3rd Jan 2017 -- MorningStar.com).

Since late 2013, The Faktory has invested in 11 companies and brought products and services to international niche markets in the areas of consumer electronics, high-technology, gaming and apps, drones, SaaS and IoT products.

The company has a team and mentors who come from all walks of life with professional experience in different countries. Furthermore, The Faktory partners with Boldstart Ventures, based in NYC, who oversaw the successful exits such as Divide (acquired by Google), GoInstant (acquired by Salesforce) and Rapportive (acquired by Linkedin).

With their professional and financial supports, we received a real boost in the R&D phase and iterated our product design into its fine-tuned stage today. All we need next is your support to launch the production and have the first batch delivered to mountain bike enthusiasts out there!
