story:
"a no-brainer for shooters who operate w/ small crews" - nofilmschool


A video tripod that does what no other can.

The International is a full size filmmakers tripod that compacts down to just 20” - small enough to carry on a plane and lightweight enough to carry anywhere. Now you can capture incredible films wherever your adventures take you.

Compact and Lightweight - meets carry on size requirements for most airlines, even international flights!

The International is made of ultra strong, lightweight carbon fiber,  weighing only 4lbs. (1.8kg) so you can take rock steady footage at the top of the Himalayas or a tropical island paradise.

Easy to use - We use custom designed aircraft aluminum twist locks with diamond knurling for all the leg stages. So they’ll last long and stand strong, wherever your adventure takes you.

Shoots as low as 2 ½ inches.

Leg angle locks at over 20 different positions including 90°. Let the perfect shot decide where to put the tripod, not the other way around.

Expands to over 5 ½ feet tall so you can get the shot you’re after without lugging extra gear.

Always there when you need it.

Strong enough to support even high end pro cameras.

Compatible with the industry standard 75mm bowl mount. It works great with heads from most manufacturers. And our QR clamp is compatible with Arca Swiss type plates from most manufacturers. It’s your gear. Use it the way you want!


SWAP System

Use our heads and they can stay mounted on the tripod even with the legs inverted - keeping it still just 20 inches long!

We love gear that stays out of our way. The SWAP System uses a 75mm half ball with quick release clamp so changing heads is effortless.


There’s even an adapter plate so you can convert your other ⅜” heads and accessories to the SWAP System.

Switching to your jib or slider is so easy it’ll bring a smile to your face.


You can even swap the heads from the tripod to the top of your jib and slider.

Fast feels good!

Instead of spending time re-configuring gear, you can focus on making a great film.

There are universal, quick release anti-twist plates that work on just about any camera. And they don’t block your camera’s battery door. So satisfying.

Whether you’re shooting with a high end pro camera, DSLR, Mirrorless, or even your phone, we’ve got you covered.

Now there’s nothing stopping you from making incredible films anywhere in the world.

Back this project and pre-order your International Tripod and SWAP system now because we've got great discounts that are going to go fast.

Rewards

International Carbon Fiber Tripod

International Carbon Kit w/ SWAP System


Specs

The International Carbon Fiber Tripod -

  • Maximum Height: 5’ 7" (*with fluid head)
  • Supports up to: 55 lb
  • Minimum Height: 2.5"
  • Folds Down to: 20.5" (*with fluid head)
  • Weighs: 4 lb
  • 75mm Half Bowl
  • 4 Sections
  • Aluminum twist locks w/ diamond knurling

Fluid Head -

  • Weight Capacity: 11 lb
  • Quick Release Clamp
  • SWAP compatible quick mount base
  • Aluminum Alloy Construction
  • Bubble Level
  • Spring-loaded Counterbalance
  • Includes Medium Quick-release Plate
  • 1/4" and 3/8" Camera Attachment
  • Additional  3/8"-16 Bottom Mount
  • Compatible with Arca Swiss type plates from most manufacturers

Photo Ball Head -

  • Weight Capacity: 25 lb
  • Quick Release Clamp
  • SWAP compatible quick mount base
  • Aluminum Alloy Construction
  • Independent pan lock and angle lock
  • Includes Short Quick-release Plate
  • 1/4" and 3/8" Camera Attachment
  • Additional 3/8"-16 Bottom Mount
  • Compatible with Arca Swiss type plates from most manufacturers

How do you get it?

Back this project now. Just click here and have fun.

Then help us spread the word by telling your friends and sharing this project. Because we’ve got some fun stretch goals planned and you can make them happen.

Thanks for your help!

story:
Welightbag is...

Bag is an essential companion in every moment of life. Welightbag is designed for the important moments. It’s changeable, personalizable and flexible to captivate those moments.

 

 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________
 
_______________________________________________________________________________________

_______________________________________________________________________________________

 

100% handmade in Taiwan

 

 

For people who loves freedom and travel

 

 

 

 

Convert your Life to your Design

 

Our Peaks

______________________________________________________________________________________

______________________________________________________________________________________

________________________________________________________________________________________

________________________________________________________________________________________

 

Story of Welightbag

 

Welightbag is the brainchild of Flora, a Taiwanese design director, upon embarking motherhood. Flora was driven to design a backpack that fits all members of the family, from the younger to the elder. As a new mom, Flora cherishes every memorable moment in life, seeing them as inspirations to design close-to-heart products.
Unlike many mass-produced goods, Flora’s vision was to create a handmade product that captures the essence of her home country, to drive the sense of belonging, to feel at home, reliable and safe. Hence from the choice of fabric, to zippers, buckles and every piece of ribbon; every single detail has been deliberately considered and handpicked locally to retain the Taiwanese touch.
Taiwan being no stranger to the changing seasons, fear of getting caught in a drizzle or a torrential rain lingers in the minds of many, especially during summer, June through September. Welightbag’s interior and exterior are made of high calibre water-resistant fibres to confront such harsh weather. Thus, keeping a backpack clean and dry has never been easier than with Welightbag.
Unsure if you should get a backpack or a sling bag? Well, Welightbag can be both! It’s not just trendy, it is interconvertible too! The most practical, durable and machine-washable backpack that weighs less than 300g any size! With anti-slip straps, breathable fabric, and even overly stuffed compartments, Welightbag remains compact and composed behind your back; destined to be your most comfortable travel companion.
Determined to provide a personalised experience, Flora and her team designed Welightbag with alterable front covers where precious photos could be framed and carried through each step of life’s most memorable events.
Welightbag is now in the market! Let’s start your adventure to capture a bag of moments!

 

 Our Team

story:
Who We Are

Easy Campin’ is a growing national company started in June of 2018 that specializes in the delivery, set up and removal of rental Travel Campers anywhere in the U.S.  We are far more than just a camper rental company however. We are a hotel on wheels ready to deliver a beautiful camper direct to you. Not only do we deliver the camper, we set it up and then remove it for you when you are done. We also include cleaning and waste removal so you don't have to worry about much as a guest using this incredibly convenient service.

But as you will soon realize, there is a technological convenience piece to this puzzle that will transform how we will order camper deliveries and provide an incredible new transparency tool to facilitate customer service. But for now, let's explain what our business is about. 

So what is a Camper Trailer? A travel trailer or camper trailer is towed behind a road vehicle to provide a place to sleep which is more comfortable and protected than a tent (although there are fold-down trailer tents). 

 

Where We Go

We deliver, set up and remove rental travel campers to all types of places throughout the United States. Our growing network of Camper Delivery Providers delivers to:

  • homes 
  • campgrounds
  • music festivals/concerts
  • race car tracks
  • food festivals
  • beer festivals
  • private land

Are you having a space remodeled at your house?  Are you building a new house and looking to save money while your dream is being built?  Maybe you’re having your kitchen remodeled or floors replaced.  Easy Campin’ can help you save money by having a hotel suite delivered for you, your family, and pets while the work gets done to any place you need it. And most of our campers will take dogs, so you don't need to cage the poor dog and pay a small mortgage to do it.

 

Perhaps you need a camper delivered to a favorite campground, or undeveloped land you own to create your own private campground. Do you need one delivered and set up at the racetrack, festival or any outdoor venue? Easy Campin’ can help make your dream a reality.

 

 

What Is Included In Your Camper Delivery?

This service is designed for convenience. You have a lot going on in your life and we know that. That's why we have taken virtually all the work off your hands and placed it in ours. This is how it works and what is included:

1.  Full concierge service. Once you place the request online or via phone, we handle everything.

2. Travel Camper with full amenities. Heat, a.c. running water, refrigerator, kitchen, bathroom, with shower/toilet.

3. Full delivery service to your destination. The Delivery Provider will safely transport their unit direct to you. 

4. Camper Set Up. Once you arrive on site there is virtually no work needed.

5. 15-20 minute walk through: Owner will either be present or provide a video to watch to learn about simple features of the unit. 

6. Camper Removal. Once you are done, our Delivery Provider will return to pick it up and take it away.

7. Full Cleaning. You are not required to thoroughly clean the camper, we handle that.

8. Waste removal. We remove the waste from the black and gray tanks safely and by code.

 

 

How We Do It All

How do we achieve all this? You may think we have invested in a thousand campers nationwide and hired drivers to deliver them in various locations across the U.S. That is not the case. Instead, we utilize a growing army of camper owners to form what we call a "Delivery Network." Each day we are signing on new Camper Delivery Providers who deliver and set up their own Travel Campers for customers. That's right, we use the very people who own and pay the bills on their own campers, enabling them turn their Campers into assets and make money on them when they are not using them.
 
There are over 9 million RV owners in the U.S. today, and most languish in driveways and yards and go unused most of the time. What we are doing is handpicking the best quality Travel Campers out there and their committed owners to join our network so they can make money on them as Camper Delivery Providers as part of our National Delivery Network.
 
 

Our Technological Plans

How is technology going to shape our success in the future?
Well, what if you could sit down on a park bench during a break, touch a button and be able to easily and quickly request a camper delivery for the future? Within 24 hours of you submitting the dates, # of guests, destination address where you want it and other pertinent info you receive a quote through the app. And in that quote is included images of your pre-ordered camper along with the photo and short bio of the person delivering it? Their track record, camper ownership history, maybe even a blurb about their #1 camping spot or outdoor/camp food. 
 
So you review the info, agree that the quote is fair and maybe even think about picking up the recipe to replicate the Camper Owners favorite dish. Then you press a button and book it. Your payment is processed before you can blink, you receive a confirmation email with the service request form attached, receipt, and you still have 15 minutes left on your break.
 

 

Transparency 

As the days pass and your Camper rental delivery date inches closer, the mobile app will remind you of certain things:

1. What to bring for supplies

2. What to pack

3. What the camper is stocked with

4. Camper amenities

You have a busy life and may forget certain things. So as you get within 24 hours of delivery:

1. Message is sent giving you the camper owners contact # so that you may communicate if it is needed.

2. Receive ETA (estimated time of arrival) information via a real time message board built inside the app.

3. The same goes for pickup and messages sent regarding ETOP (Estimated Time Of Pickup) 

4. Any other pertinent reminders they should stay informed on.

5. Finally, after the service is completed within 24 hours a final short text message (survey) is sent to the customer asking how their experience was. This enables us to track performance. 

Customer Service For Camper Delivery

During the entire Delivery service process, the customer will have all the answers in the palm of their hand. They can:

1. Track the Campers location real time using GPS

2. Stay informed as to any delays and changes that will be sent via the app message board 

3. Have a direct link to the camper owner at all times

4. Prevent any disconnects with communication, expectations or feelings of the unknown

Provider Performance Tracking

The more services we run, the more important it's going to be to store, track and use the data related to each Delivery Provider. Are they on time? Do they have a history of not showing up? How do they handle the customer? Is the camper the same quality as described and shown in images? Did they cause damage to the guests property? All this information must have a place to be stored and protected so that we can properly manage our delivery network moving forward.  In time, we hope to create algorithms for this data that can be used to produce real time "Service Ratings" for each provider where we can use it to prioritize them when it comes to service selection. 

 

 

Why We Do This

We are a company that has chosen to work hard for important causes as part of our Mission Statement. We contribute to Veterans Groups, the American Cancer Society, The Humane Society, The Aids Healthcare Foundation and more.  We contribute by creating our own professional, premium content Videos for charity. These videos are designed by us and donated so that these causes and charities can use them to help spread awareness about important issues or to spur donations to allow that group to flourish and continue their mission. Here are a few that we have created and donated in order to raise awareness and donations:

 

 

Campin' For A Cause

Starting this year our Camper Delivery Providers will be donating their campers at their choosing for children and adults suffering from life threatening or debilitating illnesses, as well as disabled veterans and the homeless.  The campers will be delivered and set up at campgrounds and private land areas across America to provide refuge, solace and comfort with their friends and families in the quiet setting of nature.
 

Our Pledge: For every Camper Owner who donates their Camper for a period of time, we will create and donate one 45 second video ad to their favorite cause to help bring awareness and donations.  We will help spread this awareness by showing the videos on social media and through other outlets.  

Why Invest In Us?

First, we are going to be around for a long time and everything we do is based on growth. We offer a unique and groundbreaking service that helps many people and has the potential to help many more. We are light years ahead of anyone else.  As for technology, we are offering a first of its kind innovation that will change the way we view campers and how we use them. We just need the resources to accomplish all this.

  • Technological Investment plans for Camper Delivery orders that provide transparency for all users and a game changing breakthroughs in customer satisfaction.
  • Camper Owners: This service allows camper owners to turn their RV's into an asset. It produces income and has the capacity to even make it a business for themselves. 
  • The Customer: The people who are renting these and having them delivered are afforded an amazing convenience for themselves and their families. Whether they are going to their homes so they can stay close while remodeling is being done or to a campground, this service offers them a chance to save money and spend more time with their families. 
  • Charitable Causes: As we grow so will our charitable contributions, we are committed to doing good and helping people. We are huge believers in taking care of one another and in the idea that in life, it isn't about how much money we make but how we treat people. 
 

Our Challenges:

Our biggest challenges remain in three areas: Advertising, Technology and Infrastructure.

Advertising/National Exposure

This service is a new and big idea that few people have heard of. So our biggest challenge above anything else is making people aware that our service even exists. This will require a substantial Marketing budget, which we are seeking by utilizing this platform. The funds are needed to invest in more Google Ads/SEO as well as a substantial increase in our Social Media campaign spending. 

Technology: Mobile App 

The second challenge is ensuring we innovate and build the technology that we need in order to grow properly and maximize efficiencies. The majority of our technology budget must go to the build and implementation of a mobile app where customers can order a Camper Delivery easily from anywhere in the same manner we order a pizza. We also need website improvements and and enhancements in order to maximize functionality and user efficiency for our customers.

Infrastructure: In-house Data System/Platform

We need to build a place to store, track and protect our information. As we grow, we will be adding more data that will need to be organized and made transparent. Our goal is to have the ability to store all information from each delivery from the gross revenue to profit, and Provider Performance Metrics that will enable us to closely track how our providers perform. In the future, we hope to assign service metric scores for each provider that will include ETA accuracy, Camper Quality, CSI (Customer Service Index) and Complaint Ratios. 

 

 

Our Final Pitch: What You Get

You will find there are numerous perks listed with incredible deals that you will not find anywhere but here. This service is valuable and convenient for many families across America but few know we exist. There is little or no competition in this market but it will not be long before more companies catch on and begin imitating our strategy and business model. While we are on the trajectory of growth, we need more help to expand faster, gain a strong tech advantage and bring exposure to our wonderful service to many more people. 

Thank you very much in advance for your contributions. And if you need anything or have a question, please feel free to call me directly. I am always here for you. 

Warmly,

Ryan Jamison

Founder/Owner, Easy Campin'

207-572-6444

Within 24 hours of you submitting the dates, # of guests, destination address where you want it and other pertinent info you receive a quote through the app. And in that quote is included images of your pre-ordered camper along with the photo and short bio of the person delivering it? Their track record, camper ownership history, maybe even a blurb about their #1 camping spot or outdoor/camp food. 
 
So you review the info, agree that the quote is fair and maybe even think about picking up the recipe to replicate the Camper Owners favorite dish. Then you press a button and book it. Your payment is processed before you can blink, you receive a confirmation email with the service request form attached, receipt, and you still have 15 minutes left on your break.
 


 

Transparency 
As the days pass and your Camper rental delivery date inches closer, the mobile app will remind you of certain things:
1. What to bring for supplies
2. What to pack
3. What the camper is stocked with
4. Camper amenities
You have a busy life and may forget certain things. So as you get within 24 hours of delivery:
1. Message is sent giving you the camper owners contact # so that you may communicate if it is needed.
2. Receive ETA (estimated time of arrival) information via a real time message board built inside the app.
3. The same goes for pickup and messages sent regarding ETOP (Estimated Time Of Pickup) 
4. Any other pertinent reminders they should stay informed on.
5. Finally, after the service is completed within 24 hours a final short text message (survey) is sent to the customer asking how their experience was. This enables us to track performance. 
Customer Service For Camper Delivery
During the entire Delivery service process, the customer will have all the answers in the palm of their hand. They can:
1. Track the Campers location real time using GPS
2. Stay informed as to any delays and changes that will be sent via the app message board 
3. Have a direct link to the camper owner at all times
4. Prevent any disconnects with communication, expectations or feelings of the unknown
Provider Performance Tracking
The more services we run, the more important it's going to be to store, track and use the data related to each Delivery Provider. Are they on time? Do they have a history of not showing up? How do they handle the customer? Is the camper the same quality as described and shown in images? Did they cause damage to the guests property? All this information must have a place to be stored and protected so that we can properly manage our delivery network moving forward.  In time, we hope to create algorithms for this data that can be used to produce real time "Service Ratings" for each provider where we can use it to prioritize them when it comes to service selection. 
 


 

Why We Do This
We are a company that has chosen to work hard for important causes as part of our Mission Statement. We contribute to Veterans Groups, the American Cancer Society, The Humane Society, The Aids Healthcare Foundation and more.  We contribute by creating our own professional, premium content Videos for charity. These videos are designed by us and donated so that these causes and charities can use them to help spread awareness about important issues or to spur donations to allow that group to flourish and continue their mission. Here are a few that we have created and donated in order to raise awareness and donations:


 


 


Campin' For A Cause
Starting this year our Camper Delivery Providers will be donating their campers at their choosing for children and adults suffering from life threatening or debilitating illnesses, as well as disabled veterans and the homeless.  The campers will be delivered and set up at campgrounds and private land areas across America to provide refuge, solace and comfort with their friends and families in the quiet setting of nature.
 
Our Pledge: For every Camper Owner who donates their Camper for a period of time, we will create and donate one 45 second video ad to their favorite cause to help bring awareness and donations.  We will help spread this awareness by showing the videos on social media and through other outlets.  

Why Invest In Us?
First, we are going to be around for a long time and everything we do is based on growth. We offer a unique and groundbreaking service that helps many people and has the potential to help many more. We are light years ahead of anyone else.  As for technology, we are offering a first of its kind innovation that will change the way we view campers and how we use them. We just need the resources to accomplish all this.

Technological Investment plans for Camper Delivery orders that provide transparency for all users and a game changing breakthroughs in customer satisfaction.
Camper Owners: This service allows camper owners to turn their RV's into an asset. It produces income and has the capacity to even make it a business for themselves. 
The Customer: The people who are renting these and having them delivered are afforded an amazing convenience for themselves and their families. Whether they are going to their homes so they can stay close while remodeling is being done or to a campground, this service offers them a chance to save money and spend more time with their families. 
Charitable Causes: As we grow so will our charitable contributions, we are committed to doing good and helping people. We are huge believers in taking care of one another and in the idea that in life, it isn't about how much money we make but how we treat people. 


 
Our Challenges:
Our biggest challenges remain in three areas: Advertising, Technology and Infrastructure.
Advertising/National Exposure
This service is a new and big idea that few people have heard of. So our biggest challenge above anything else is making people aware that our service even exists. This will require a substantial Marketing budget, which we are seeking by utilizing this platform. The funds are needed to invest in more Google Ads/SEO as well as a substantial increase in our Social Media campaign spending. 
Technology: Mobile App 
The second challenge is ensuring we innovate and build the technology that we need in order to grow properly and maximize efficiencies. The majority of our technology budget must go to the build and implementation of a mobile app where customers can order a Camper Delivery easily from anywhere in the same manner we order a pizza. We also need website improvements and and enhancements in order to maximize functionality and user efficiency for our customers.
Infrastructure: In-house Data System/Platform
We need to build a place to store, track and protect our information. As we grow, we will be adding more data that will need to be organized and made transparent. Our goal is to have the ability to store all information from each delivery from the gross revenue to profit, and Provider Performance Metrics that will enable us to closely track how our providers perform. In the future, we hope to assign service metric scores for each provider that will include ETA accuracy, Camper Quality, CSI (Customer Service Index) and Complaint Ratios. 
 

 
Our Final Pitch: What You Get
You will find there are numerous perks listed with incredible deals that you will not find anywhere but here. This service is valuable and convenient for many families across America but few know we exist. There is little or no competition in this market but it will not be long before more companies catch on and begin imitating our strategy and business model. While we are on the trajectory of growth, we need more help to expand faster, gain a strong tech advantage and bring exposure to our wonderful service to many more people. 
Thank you very much in advance for your contributions. And if you need anything or have a question, please feel free to call me directly. I am always here for you. 
Warmly,
Ryan Jamison
Founder/Owner, Easy Campin'
207-572-6444

story:
The Kobuk Roll-Top Leather Backpack

-

The Ultimate Adventure Pack

Top Grain, Roll-Top Leather Backpack

Our Story

We are Kodiak Leather (www.kodiakleather.com), a startup in Lehi, Utah founded by Jared Morse, an outdoorsman who was frustrated by the lack of reasonably priced leather bags that would hold up through all the wear and tear of daily use. This inspired Jared to create Kodiak Leather and our custom leather bags. After finding only the highest quality leather and hardware, we set out to build a bag that would last a lifetime. 

Fast Forward 3 1/2 Years...

After having 3 successful Kickstarter campaigns, the Buffalo Leather Satchel, The Classic Weekender Duffel, and our most recent Sitka Leather Messenger, we have come full circle on offering a wide variety of travel bags (mainly duffel bags), briefcases (similar to the satchel and the messenger), as well as some smaller, everyday carry items. 

We have had countless insights on product design, future product offerings, and functionality suggestions from our nearly 2700 previous backers.  

We have had many requests over the last couple of years to produce a leather backpack, that kept the rugged, adventure-ready Kodiak Leather look and feel, while maintaining functionality and a reasonable price point.

Well..  We are happy to introduce the Kobuk Roll-Top Leather Backpack.

This design was inspired by a roll-top leather duffel bag we came across that was super functional (could handle a good amount of gear), and had a bulletproof look about it.

The Kobuk Roll-Top Backpack was designed with functionality, durability and simplicity in mind.

True to Kodiak Leather form, we wanted this bag to have the same "Alaska - Ready" look to it,  while being able to accommodate a wide variety of daily uses and individuals.

Whether you’re headed up to the mountains for a hike, taking it to the office, or packing this to class,  this pack was designed with you in mind!

New Rewards + Pledge Levels Added!!

Available in 3 color options:

Antique Brown

Midnight Black

Dark Walnut

Core Features:

  • Top-grain leather
  • Padded, adjustable Backpack Straps
  • Zippered opening to keep items secure
  • Adjustable buckle closure on main bag opening
  • Adjustable magnetic buckle closure on front pocket
  • Zippered side pocket to keep phone, wallet or keys secure
  • Easy access open side pocket for water bottle or other smaller items
  • D-ring on each side for carabiner, water bottle, ID, or luggage tags 
  • Fully padded laptop sleeve on the back wall of the bag (Will fit 13" or 15"laptops)
  • Large front pocket with flap for added security and weather-proofing
  • Top backpack handle for easy carry
  • Interior phone pocket on front of laptop sleeve
  • 3 interior pen holders on front of laptop sleeve
  • 1 interior metal doghook for keys on front of laptop sleeve

Full Product Specs:

Dimensions:

  •  Exterior II 21" H x 13" W x 11" D 
  •  Interior II 20" x 12" W x 10" D
  •  Weight II  3 lbs 8 oz.   
  •  Padded Laptop Sleeve II Located on the back wall of pack, measures 12" W x 13" H x 2" D. This sleeve will fit 13", 15" and some 17" laptops (message us if you have questions on this!)
  •  Shoulder Strap Length II  Each strap is fully adjustable from 17" to 33"

Materials:

  • Top-Grain Leather 
  • Brass Hardware 
  • Premium YKK Metal Zippers 

-Rewards-

Kobuk Leather Backpack

The ULTIMATE Adventure Combo Pack

This pledge level includes:

  • 1- Kobuk Leather Backpack
  • 1- Wanderer Leather Journal
  • 1- 17 oz. Insulated, Stainless Steel Water Bottle 

Wanderer Leather Journal

  • 110 blank pages
  • Handmade artisan paper
  • Wrap around leather closure
  • Dimensions: 5" x 7" 

Kodiak Water Bottle

 Available in 4 color options:

Project Timeline

  •  March 2018: Idea + Design and prototyping of Kobuk Backpack begin  
  •  April 2018: Finalize design, finalize leather colors and hardware types/ placement, begin manufacturing of samples 
  •  June 2018: First samples completed.  Revise size and layout of bag.  Add padding to laptop sleeve. Add D-rings on sides, and zippered pockets. Product testing begins.
  •  July 2018: Second samples received.  Revise front pocket size, buckle strap length, and side pocket sizing. Widen shoulder straps and add more padding.
  •  September 2018: Final prototype is finished. Along with other designs for campaign. Final colors selected. 
  •  October 29, 2018: Launch Kickstarter campaign.
  •  December 18, 2018: Kickstarter campaign ends.
  •  January 2, 2019: Receive funds from Kickstarter. Begin production/ manufacturing of rewards.
  • January 9, 2019: Launch Indiegogo campaign
  •  February 2019: Begin shipping rewards.
  •  March 2019: Remaining reward fulfillment completed.

Why Support Us?

In order to make these products come to life, we need to raise $10,000 to complete our first run of production.  

If you pledge to this campaign you will be the FIRST to receive these products and you will be getting them for a MUCH lower price than they will cost once they are available to the public! We understand that making a pledge is a big commitment and we want to reward you accordingly!!

Purchase a product that is GUARANTEED for LIFE. All of our products come with a lifetime guarantee. Leather looks better with age. Someday your Kodiak Leather product will tell a story of it's own.  

Rewards Selection:

  • Select the pledge that matches the item you want to pre-order. If our goal is reached, you will be charged at the end of the campaign, and we will ship your reward as soon as it is made! If our goal is not reached, your card will NOT be charged, and you will not receive the product. 
  • With your support and pledging towards our Kodiak Leather products, you will be making a HUGE difference in the Kodiak Leather manufacturing process, and will help us make the Kobuk Roll-Top Leather Backpack available to everyone.

Lifetime Warranty

Every Kodiak Leather bag is made for a lifetime of use. In fact, we believe in our craftsmen, our materials and our designs so much that we warranty them against defects in materials and workmanship. If there is ever a problem with one of our products just send it back and we will either repair or replace it for free.

story:
Odorless, Invisible, Insect Repellent!

NoBu.gs® Repellent Clothing and Gear was created with comfort in mind!  Our clothing is designed with functional fabrics and unique elements that come from ideas directly from our customers.  No more smelly sprays or ineffective substitutes.  Our clothes effectively repels mosquitos, ticks, fleas, flies, ants and many other biting insects to 97% just by getting dressed! Many of these bugs can carry disease such as Zika, Dengue, Lyme!

 

What Makes Our Repellent Better?

Our products can be used by the entire family, with no restriction for use!  And its machine washable!  Effective for 70 washings which exceeds the lifetime of most clothes in your closet!

 

 

UPF 50+ Blocks 99% of Harmful Sun Rays!

In addition to insect repellent, our clothing is UPF 50+ which blocks 99% of harmful UV rays from the sun.  Have a hard time getting the kids ready for the elements with sunblock and insect repellent sprays?  That is no longer an issue with our line of clothing.  We've put a lot of thought into this line and we know you'll love it!  

 

Putting It to The Test!

We made a test batch of clothes for our friends and family and the response has been amazing!  You can see from our pictures how comfortable the clothes are even on a hot summer day.  Playing outside and knowing that your loved ones are protected from bug bites and the sun two less things to worry about! 

Don't Know Us?  You Know These Guys!

NoBu.gs® ingredient brand of repellent is registered by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) for repellency against mosquitos, ticks, ants, fleas, flies, chiggers, and midges (no-see-ums).  Some of these insects are so small they cannot be seen by the naked eye, but NoBu.gs® has you covered. 

The repellent treatment is so effective it is a trusted solution by military outfits around the globe including the United States Military.  The clothing is registered with the EPA for up to 70 launderings but is expected to last the lifetime of the garment. 

The Center for Disease Control (CDC) and the World Health Organization (WHO) list insect repellent clothing, such as NoBu.gs®, as one of the best ways to avoid contraction of insect borne disease such as Dengue, Zika, Malaria and Lyme.   

What People are Saying About NoBu.gs!

The Perks!

We had great success with our line of men's clothing but now we are ready to launch our line of women's and children's clothing.  We have several packages and we hope you find one that is right for you and your family.  The pricing you get for participating in our campaign will not be available once our products come to the mass market.  We want our backers to be highly rewarded for helping us bring the new line to life!  

You can always buy multiple perks. Simply buy your first perk. Once you've received confirmation for your first order repeat the process for any additional perks. 

When Will I Get It?

We are putting a rush on it!  We already have a small amount in production so the Early Birds will get the orders the fastest.  The balance will be ready in October.  

*We offer worldwide shipping to our International Backers. Although many countries like the USA do not charge on international drop shipments, International shipments may be subject to import taxes, duties and customs fees, which are levied once your package reaches the country of destination, and are the responsibility of the recipient. We will do our best to minimize any of these charges.

The NoBit.es Foundation!

In 2017 NoBu.gs® started the non-profit NoBit.es™.  Our organization works with community leaders to match us with families that need our products the most!  Visit us at http://www.nobit.es to see how we’ve been helping.

We are very excited to partner with our non-profit organization, NoBit.es™, in this campaign.  Your purchase, small or large, will help people in across the globe battling the fight against insect borne disease.  NoBu.gs® will donate a shirt or net with each purchase and NoBit.es™ will identify the need and distribute accordingly.  

Want more info?  

Check out our FAQ's on our website.  https://www.nobugsclothing.com/pages/faqs 

Risks & Challenges

With extensive knowledge of manufacturing we are confident in our ability to deliver an outstanding product on time. The first round of production is underway and the first supporters will receive products within a few weeks after ending the campaign.  We have worked with all of our partners before and have set aside time for production and fulfillment just for this campaign. However, even with checks and balances in place there is always a chance for some delays.  We will keep our backers updated every step of the way and we are always here to answer questions you may have.  

The biggest potential challenge comes down to sizing and ensuring our customers select the right size.  Due to the high temperature of the treatment process we do manufacture sizing a little larger than normal.  If you prefer a slim fit we recommend going one size down. Please take a good look at our sizing charts and feel free to shoot us a message if you need any help.

*The Onesie runs a bit big.  

*The Hoodie runs a bit big.  

*The Long Sleeve Shirt runs a bit small.

Other Ways You Can Help

These packages might not be right for you but maybe someone you know.  Please help us out by sharing our campaign with friends and family.

story:
Welcome to your unexpected journey
 

Hello and welcome to the Park of Fantasy!

The Park of Fantasy is a dream dreamed by a small group of visionaries. We want to give you the chance to dive into a world full of fantasy. We are a Team of seven persons who want to create an adventure park which includes a holiday resort. The most of us are passionate fantasy fans, LARP player or cosplayer. Others are more intrested into videogames, literature, photo- and filmography. Together we want to bring YOU the complete feeling of living in a fantastic world!

 

What is the campaign about?

 

Our campaign is all about funding the Park of Fantasy in Hungary, Europe. The Park of Fantasy is an adventure world with different accommodations to rent and a big variety of leisure activities. The Park of Fantasy  will be a pure LARP (Live Action Role Play) and Archery/Crossbow project, at first. This means that in the first time we'll have tents in different sizes and comforts. Also we will have guesting houses, an archery and crossbow - shootingrange and an Archery Attack™ -field.

Archery Attack™

 

 

Later on, the different offers for animations, such as:

  • horse riding
  • swimming,
  • boat rentals,
  • blacksmithing,
  • swordplay, etc.,

and also events, such as big LARPs, festivals, e.t.c., will follow.

Also we'll start to build up rental houses next to the tents. There will also be different sizes and comfort standarts for the houses.

Please visit our Website for further informations. Thank you!

Vision for the Park of Fantasy in 2019

 

What do we need your financial help for?

 

With your financial help we want to collect an amount of 320'000 € for the first part of the Park of Fantasy, which includes:

  • 120 different tents in different comfort standarts
  • 2 guesting houses
  • the shooting range
  • the Archery Attack™ - field and the Archery Attack™ equiptment
  • the LARP fields
  • decorations for the fields
  • the staff

 

 

What happens if the funding goal won't be reached?

If we can't collect the 320'000 €, all your promised funds will not be debited from your bank accounts. If we can't reach the fund goal the whole project will be cancelled.

 

 

 

What are our thoughts behind the Park of Fantasy?

 

Together with you, we want to create one of the biggest LARP-, Fantasy- and Cosplay communities. We want to bring together all the fans of our planet and we want to give you and us the opportunity to live our passion with like-minded people in an authentic place.

 

Help us to realize the Park of Fantasy

 

Help us to realize the Park of Fantasy by booking your accommodations, tell your friends and family about our campaign and share our idea on the social networks. We'd love to welcome you soon at the Park of Fantasy!

Kind regards

Emilia, Gabor, Mike, Danny, Eleonora, Julien and Patrik

The Park of Fantasy - Team

story:
About this project

SAVIOR,  is the world’s 1st titanium double-sided screwdriver including bottle opener with its titanium key ring. After all successful design and manufacturing stages it is finally ready to show you.

 

We aimed to produce a strong, compact and versatile EDC (every day carry) tool which can be a savior when you have it and makes your daily things easier. In order to be successful, we firstly focused on people’s daily life. By doing so we obtained the knowledge of what kind of things they mostly face with every day. Then according to this knowledge the design and prototype stages were started and finalized successfully.

SAVIOR, attached to a titanium key ring, is the world’s most compact, brilliant and multipurpose titanium tool which will be a savior in your pocket!

PRODUCT INFORMATION

Material: Titanium Grade 5 has high strength, low weight ratio and outstanding corrosion resistance. Thus we used Titanium Grade 5 for Savior 

Weight: Since SAVIOR is made from titanium it is very light, 6 gr.

5 axes CNC milling machine is used to manufacture each SAVIOR which enables use to produce them at minimal time and maximum quality. Then, sandblasting is used in order to obtain a visually better product. We quarantee our backers by providing them SAVIOR at minimal time, maximum material, manufacturing and visual quality.

Risks and challenges

We simplified manufacturing of SAVIOR very much by using 5 axes CNC milling machine. Since it cuts rapidly with a good quality, we do not have a time problem. Only some machining malfunctions and some other production related mishaps can slightly delay production. However, since we planned our existing production plan as including such slight delays, we feel very confident that your SAVIOR will be on your pocket on time.

story:
The Back Story

As a fulltime traveling family making new friends, we never knew where our friends were. Many times we would be in the same campground. Sometimes even within a couple of spots. We have been in the middle of the desert and was parked next to one of our friends on Instagram and didn't know until the 3rd day after changing our Wi-Fi SSID to our Instagram name and they saw it.

For the last 2 years we have been working on a social media platform that would solve this problem. We call it Fernweh. A feeling of homesickness for places you've never been. This community will help travelers come to together, share their travels, and connect in a more real way than other social media platforms allow.

 

The Plan 

We are currently in Phase 2 which is the most crucial phase of the launch. For the Fernweh platform to succeed and grow as a top community platform it will need to be turned into an app and be heavy marketed. The framework for the app build is fully ready and the marketing plan is set up.  Both teams are ready to push hard and take Fernweh to the next level. 

The App will take approximately 3 to 5 days to be in testing phase and about  1 week to be in the Google Play and Apple store and ready to use. It will sync with the website so members can switch devices with no issues.  The cost of the app development will cost just over $1,400 one time fee and monthly $500 for hosting and maintenance. We will also need to switch to a dedicated hosting server for the website and database to handle the influx of members and to scale the server size easily without any downtime. The dedicated server cost starts out at $200 a month. 

Marketing will be done through Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and LinkedIn.  Marketing budget depends on the amount of funding we receive. The more marketing budget we have the harder we can push which will allow us to get in front of the most people. Our minimum marketing goal is $5,000.

We have set our overall goal to $15,000. This will make sure everything is paid to launch as well as maintain the hosting and maintenance cost for a year. 

 

Why Support Fernweh

When you support Fernweh you are helping bring a real community. A community that so many travelers desire to have and long for. This platform will not only bring the traveling community together, but also allow travelers to plan their routes, share images and videos from their route, and allow travelers to write full articles about their travels. Not only will this help other travelers but it will also help support the economy and businesses from members sharing their experiences and stories from each business and attraction.

 

Gifts to Our Supporters

We have set up a contribution plan of 11 levels ranging from $5 - $5000. Below are the levels and what you receive.

  • Level 1: $5  -    Get a Ferweh Pen and a Fernweh Kiss Cut Sticker
  • Level 2: $10 -  Get a Ferweh Pen,  a Fernweh Kiss Cut Sticker, and Fernweh Sunglasses
  • Level 3: $20 - Get a Ferweh Pen,  a Fernweh Kiss Cut Sticker, and Fernweh Sunglasses, and a Fernweh Stainless Steel Travel Mug
  • Level 4: $30 - Get a Ferweh Pen,  a Fernweh Kiss Cut Sticker, and Fernweh Sunglasses,  a Fernweh Stainless Steel Travel Mug, and a Fernweh Hat
  • Level 5: $50 - Get a Ferweh Pen,  a Fernweh Kiss Cut Sticker, and Fernweh Sunglasses, a Fernweh Stainless Steel Travel Mug, a Fernweh Hat, and a Fernweh Hiking Backpack
  • Level 6: $100 Get a Ferweh Pen,  a Fernweh Kiss Cut Sticker, and Fernweh Sunglasses, a Fernweh Stainless Steel Travel Mug, a Fernweh Hat, a Fernweh Hiking Backpack, and a 1 year premium business listing in the Directory
  • Level 7: $200 - $100 Get a Ferweh Pen,  a Fernweh Kiss Cut Sticker, and Fernweh Sunglasses, a Fernweh Stainless Steel Travel Mug, a Fernweh Hat, a Fernweh Hiking Backpack, and a 1 year premium business listing in the Directory, and a 1 month free side bar ads
  • Bronze Sponsor: $500 - Get all perks plus be listed on our Sponsors page as a Bronze Sponsor.
  • Silver Sponsor: $1000 - Get all perks plus be listed on our Sponsors page as a Silver Sponsor
  • Gold Sponsor: $2000 - Get all perks plus be listed on our Sponsors page as a Gold Sponsor
  • Platinum Sponsor: $5000 - Get all perks plus be listed on our Sponsors page as a Platinum Sponsor

 

Other Ways to Support Fernweh

We understand not everyone can afford to support a cause financially. We also understand that there are more ways than money to support something you love. Word of mouth is the best alternative support. The more people that share our platform and our crowdfunding the more likely we are to succeed. If 10 people shared with 10 of their friends and they all told  10 of their friends, by the time it reached the 6th group it would be shared by 1 million people.

story:
Once an extreme birthday party, now slated 

"The Coolest Kids Race On The Planet!"

 

Motivation

At the Kids Adventure Games we have some big ideas on getting more and more kids involved to "Be an Outsider" and "Thrive Outside", creating memories not only for the kids but for parents, grandparents and friends. 

After 10 years in Vail and 5 seasons of visiting premier destinations nationwide, receiving a consistent 94% approval rate, we have proven our concept and gained a tremendous amount of insight on how our event is perceived and executed and how to move into the next decade. 

What we learned is that "The Kids Adventure Games" has taken on a life of its own and has become much bigger than our birthday party. We feel a great responsibility on course but also for the impact the experience has on our athletes, parents, grandparents, non-participatory spectators, staff, volunteers, and our alumnis.

Young people are 40% of the population but they are 100% of our future. We aim to encourage children to become independent thinkers, expand their vision and show them their worth. With your support and generosity, we can continue this journey. 

Please read below about our past, present and our future strategic vision, our challenges, our goals and how we plan to get there.        

Thank you for reading, sharing with your network and contributing to the future of the Kids Adventure Games. 

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

“Priceless. The sense of achievement I felt from my kids made me so very proud.

A really great, unique event" Big Sky Mom

                                             

 "Magic in Motion" 

Our mission is to make an impact globally, encouraging kids to "Be an Outsider" and "Thrive Outside", inspiring them to set goals and go way further than what they think they can do. Mainly though, we want the kids to have fun. Combine the two and you have the recipe for 'The Kids Adventure Games'. We are looking to raise funds for marketing, operations and expanding into additional markets.

 

 

The Event

The Kids Adventure Games offers kids, ages 6 through 14, the opportunity to experience the thrill of adventure racing.  During the race, teams of two will work together to navigate a variety of sports and problem-solving challenges, hiking, tubing, archery, a ropes course, a zip line, a climbing wall, a Tarzan swing, a giant slip-n-slide and more, all the while studying their map to get through the course in the fastest possible time. The races emphasize teamwork, problem solving, sportsmanship, environmental awareness and fun. The kids cross the finish line, muddy, sweaty, smiling and full of pride. 

 

 

Unique

There is no other race like this in the world.  The sport of Obstacle Racing attracted 6,000,000 adult weekend warriors in 2019. Globally the numbers are thought to reach over 20,000,000 and growing rapidly.

In this space, The Kids Adventure Games is the only event of this kind. We are not just an obstacle course: we identify as an adventure race which is a multidisciplinary team sport where kids follow a map to pass through checkpoints and which involve adventurous obstacles inspired by the wilderness terrain.

The race will encourage team independence as family members will only be allowed to spectate and watch as the teams of two navigate the course. “Part of the fun will be to allow the kids to take ownership of the race and do it themselves,” said Mattison. “We’ll have plenty of checkpoints, aid stations and course marshals to help as needed.”

Parents understand this recipe for success: to be challenged yet have fun, be determined, develop good character, sportsmanship, teamwork, build grit and resilience, be able to think on your feet and finish the day with a smile. That’s what the Kids Adventure Games creates with each of its races: An exceptional kids event with far reaching, lifelong lessons. The Kids Adventure Games builds community and encourages environmental stewardship. 


 

Our Story

Ever since our founders, Billy and Hélène  Mattison, met in Meribel, France they have managed to breathe adventure into every aspect of their lives. When their twins were born it became a passion to create experiences that would be fun for their kids and friends. Just like Walt Disney, who himself was out with his children and had a revelation and an idea on how he could create experiences for children and families that would transform their lives.

And so, starting with their twins' 1st birthday party, The Mattisons made it an annual event to design an adventure course for their kids and friends. First in their backyard and later in a local campground, set in mountainous and snow covered terrain, early November, every year. Adding zip lines, biking, hiking, cargo nets, rappelling, rafting and orienteering over the years, the vision for the Kids Adventure Games began taking shape. 

In the kids' kindergarten year, The Mattisons approached the Town of Vail Recreation District about co-producing an annual event during the summer months. With only 50 spots available as a single day event in its inaugural year, it was wildly successful. Within 4 years, the event grew into a 5 day festival with multiple length courses and skills clinics, with over 1200 kids vying for a spot. Trying a few additional markets between 2014 and 2019, the Kids Adventure Games is a proven concept and the groundwork is laid for a larger vision.

 

 

"Dear Helene and the KAG team!

This event is SO AWESOME! Teagan and Eli (Coed 8-9 year old category) had THE BEST TIME! They loved every minute of the race and we loved seeing them push themselves and support each other along the route. We love how this event promotes and teaches the kids about what it means to work as a team and support others…and how to overcome obstacles. It teaches them about sportsmanship and being mindful of their environment. Both kids walked away from the event feeling proud of their accomplishments and excited to try new and exciting things.

Thank you very much for your hard work and dedication to this event! WE LOVE IT!

Haley & Scott Kelly; (Teagan’s parents); Park City, UT"

 

 

Challenges

Marketing and Advertising:

Our largest challenge is raising awareness of the event. Up until this point, we have primarily grown via word of mouth. In order to achieve our goal of reaching more kids we need to increase visibility of the event through a media campaign, and strategic partnerships.

Operations:

Traveling nationwide with all of our equipment is tough on vehicle maintenance, travel cost and long hours of driving. To be able to alleviate this we need to double our equipment and double our operations team.

 

 

"All 4 of my girls participate every year,  and their cousins and now a many of their friends. We plan for it every year. But it was a challenge to get my 8 year old to do it, she rarely wanted to go outside. She surprised herself when finishing her first year of the Kids Adventure Games. Now 3 years later and a regular at the Stowe races, she loves her homemade, Kids Adventure Games inspired course in her backyard."

Bethany Gibson, Concord Mass.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Vision

  • Creating a participatory 'stay-cation' for active families in premier destinations around the world. A proven concept in the Town of Vail, CO, with 3 days of racing, 2 days of skills clinics, a Family Adventure Zone, merchandising, evening entertainment and ancillary events like an obstacle run for the whole family and a balance bike race for kids up until 5 years of age
  • Exploring franchising options, on a global scale

 

Additionally: 

  • The Kids Adventure Games as a National and International Series with a World Championship as early as 2021.
  • An inclusive event for athletes will all abilities
  • Partnerships with nonprofits to engage in fundraising aspects
  • An internship program for college outdoor education programs. 

 

 

The Ask

Self funded for many years, with additional sponsorships, it's been mostly a labor of love. Now in our 6th year, in order to be a sustainable company and expand, we need to restructure with a first round of funding that is based on this financial model. 

Funding Goals in order of importance:

Marketing

  • Through more quality and quantity visibility we can 10x our participation. ($35,000)

Operations 

  • Funds towards updating our equipment like ropes, harnesses and climbing hardware. Investing in newly designed obstacles and a general face-lift of  the start/finish area and signage. ($7,500)

Stretch goals: (if the target funing is reached, additional monies will be allocated toward:)

  • Put efforts toward expanding our reach to the Eastern Seaboard and Southern States. This would mean building an additional team, as well as doubling our equipment to increase the number  of events we are able to put on. 
  • Put efforts toward franchising and licensing the event.                                                           

 

 

About Us

An award winning, dynamic duo, Billy & Hélène Mattison, have been promoting, designing and directing (adventure) race courses for over 17 years through their company, Grand Traverse Adventures, Inc.

Eco-Challenge Champion and Award Winning Race Director and Course Designer, Billy exemplifies unwavering determination, inherent mental strength and inspiring enthusiasm for outdoor adventure. A natural born leader and storyteller, Billy is a master at enticing kids to go farther than they thought possible and make them want to do it again. As co-owner and head boatman of Timberline Tours International Whitewater, his river skills and leadership are legendary in paddling circles with a whitewater career spanning 30 years. During the winter season, Billy works as a Supervisor of the Vail Ski Patrol.  He is an accomplished mountaineer and loves spending his free time touring the backcountry, skiing off a 14,000ft peak or leading an ice ascent in Vail. He averages 40 days annually above 12,000 feet in the Colorado Rockies.  Billy has climbed several mountains over 20,000 feet around the world. 

Hélène, originally from Holland, has a Degree in Physical Education, with a background in accounting, database management, and computer technology. Having worked on numerous adventure race team support crews across the globe in exotic and challenging locations, Hélène is well versed in race logistics. Hélène is the Race Promoter of the event series and is responsible for coordinating events including designing race courses, staffing, team support, event sponsorship and all administrative responsibilities involved in organization of international and national races.

The Kids Adventure Games race directing team are a group of dedicated outdoor professionals who work hard at the safety, creativity and innovation of the courses. 

Grand Traverse Adventures has been race directing for the GoPro™ Mountain Games
and World T.E.A.M. Sports, before creating the Kids Adventure Games™.

 

 

Other ways to help

Contact us directly if you have ideas and introductions you may make for us to help further the event:

  • decision makers in companies for partner opportunities, sponsorship
  • vendors who would want to be apart of the expo (link on website)
  • volunteerism (link on website)
  • interns
  • speakers
  • influencers
  • swag and raffle prizes for the kids
  • foundation we may want to affiliate with

 

Sponsorship areas

  • Gasoline Companies
  • Vehicles
  • Apparel
  • Energy Bars
  • Outdoor Equipment
  • Media Partner
  • Travel Partner
  • Lodging Partner
  • etc.

Thank you for sharing in your network, supporting our efforts and we will see you on course this summer! 

Our 2020 schedule will be reduced while we implement our strategic plan.

A really great, unique event" Big Sky Mom                                              "Magic in Motion" Our mission is to make an impact globally, encouraging kids to "Be an Outsider" and "Thrive Outside", inspiring them to set goals and go way further than what they think they can do. Mainly though, we want the kids to have fun. Combine the two and you have the recipe for 'The Kids Adventure Games'. We are looking to raise funds for marketing, operations and expanding into additional markets.  The EventThe Kids Adventure Games offers kids, ages 6 through 14, the opportunity to experience the thrill of adventure racing.  During the race, teams of two will work together to navigate a variety of sports and problem-solving challenges, hiking, tubing, archery, a ropes course, a zip line, a climbing wall, a Tarzan swing, a giant slip-n-slide and more, all the while studying their map to get through the course in the fastest possible time. The races emphasize teamwork, problem solving, sportsmanship, environmental awareness and fun. The kids cross the finish line, muddy, sweaty, smiling and full of pride.   UniqueThere is no other race like this in the world.  The sport of Obstacle Racing attracted 6,000,000 adult weekend warriors in 2019. Globally the numbers are thought to reach over 20,000,000 and growing rapidly.In this space, The Kids Adventure Games is the only event of this kind. We are not just an obstacle course: we identify as an adventure race which is a multidisciplinary team sport where kids follow a map to pass through checkpoints and which involve adventurous obstacles inspired by the wilderness terrain.The race will encourage team independence as family members will only be allowed to spectate and watch as the teams of two navigate the course. “Part of the fun will be to allow the kids to take ownership of the race and do it themselves,” said Mattison. “We’ll have plenty of checkpoints, aid stations and course marshals to help as needed.”Parents understand this recipe for success: to be challenged yet have fun, be determined, develop good character, sportsmanship, teamwork, build grit and resilience, be able to think on your feet and finish the day with a smile. That’s what the Kids Adventure Games creates with each of its races: An exceptional kids event with far reaching, lifelong lessons. The Kids Adventure Games builds community and encourages environmental stewardship.  Our StoryEver since our founders, Billy and Hélène  Mattison, met in Meribel, France they have managed to breathe adventure into every aspect of their lives. When their twins were born it became a passion to create experiences that would be fun for their kids and friends. Just like Walt Disney, who himself was out with his children and had a revelation and an idea on how he could create experiences for children and families that would transform their lives.And so, starting with their twins' 1st birthday party, The Mattisons made it an annual event to design an adventure course for their kids and friends. First in their backyard and later in a local campground, set in mountainous and snow covered terrain, early November, every year. Adding zip lines, biking, hiking, cargo nets, rappelling, rafting and orienteering over the years, the vision for the Kids Adventure Games began taking shape. In the kids' kindergarten year, The Mattisons approached the Town of Vail Recreation District about co-producing an annual event during the summer months. With only 50 spots available as a single day event in its inaugural year, it was wildly successful. Within 4 years, the event grew into a 5 day festival with multiple length courses and skills clinics, with over 1200 kids vying for a spot. Trying a few additional markets between 2014 and 2019, the Kids Adventure Games is a proven concept and the groundwork is laid for a larger vision. 

 
"Dear Helene and the KAG team!This event is SO AWESOME! Teagan and Eli (Coed 8-9 year old category) had THE BEST TIME! They loved every minute of the race and we loved seeing them push themselves and support each other along the route. We love how this event promotes and teaches the kids about what it means to work as a team and support others…and how to overcome obstacles. It teaches them about sportsmanship and being mindful of their environment. Both kids walked away from the event feeling proud of their accomplishments and excited to try new and exciting things.Thank you very much for your hard work and dedication to this event! WE LOVE IT!Haley & Scott Kelly; (Teagan’s parents); Park City, UT"  ChallengesMarketing and Advertising: Our largest challenge is raising awareness of the event. Up until this point, we have primarily grown via word of mouth. In order to achieve our goal of reaching more kids we need to increase visibility of the event through a media campaign, and strategic partnerships.Operations: Traveling nationwide with all of our equipment is tough on vehicle maintenance, travel cost and long hours of driving. To be able to alleviate this we need to double our equipment and double our operations team.  "All 4 of my girls participate every year,  and their cousins and now a many of their friends. We plan for it every year. But it was a challenge to get my 8 year old to do it, she rarely wanted to go outside. She surprised herself when finishing her first year of the Kids Adventure Games. Now 3 years later and a regular at the Stowe races, she loves her homemade, Kids Adventure Games inspired course in her backyard."Bethany Gibson, Concord Mass.          Vision
Creating a participatory 'stay-cation' for active families in premier destinations around the world. A proven concept in the Town of Vail, CO, with 3 days of racing, 2 days of skills clinics, a Family Adventure Zone, merchandising, evening entertainment and ancillary events like an obstacle run for the whole family and a balance bike race for kids up until 5 years of age
Exploring franchising options, on a global scale
 Additionally: 
The Kids Adventure Games as a National and International Series with a World Championship as early as 2021.
An inclusive event for athletes will all abilities
Partnerships with nonprofits to engage in fundraising aspects
An internship program for college outdoor education programs. 
  The AskSelf funded for many years, with additional sponsorships, it's been mostly a labor of love. Now in our 6th year, in order to be a sustainable company and expand, we need to restructure with a first round of funding that is based on this financial model. Funding Goals in order of importance:MarketingThrough more quality and quantity visibility we can 10x our participation. ($35,000)Operations Funds towards updating our equipment like ropes, harnesses and climbing hardware. Investing in newly designed obstacles and a general face-lift of  the start/finish area and signage. ($7,500)Stretch goals: (if the target funing is reached, additional monies will be allocated toward:)
Put efforts toward expanding our reach to the Eastern Seaboard and Southern States. This would mean building an additional team, as well as doubling our equipment to increase the number  of events we are able to put on. 
Put efforts toward franchising and licensing the event.                                                           
  About UsAn award winning, dynamic duo, Billy & Hélène Mattison, have been promoting, designing and directing (adventure) race courses for over 17 years through their company, Grand Traverse Adventures, Inc.Eco-Challenge Champion and Award Winning Race Director and Course Designer, Billy exemplifies unwavering determination, inherent mental strength and inspiring enthusiasm for outdoor adventure. A natural born leader and storyteller, Billy is a master at enticing kids to go farther than they thought possible and make them want to do it again. As co-owner and head boatman of Timberline Tours International Whitewater, his river skills and leadership are legendary in paddling circles with a whitewater career spanning 30 years. During the winter season, Billy works as a Supervisor of the Vail Ski Patrol.  He is an accomplished mountaineer and loves spending his free time touring the backcountry, skiing off a 14,000ft peak or leading an ice ascent in Vail. He averages 40 days annually above 12,000 feet in the Colorado Rockies.  Billy has climbed several mountains over 20,000 feet around the world. Hélène, originally from Holland, has a Degree in Physical Education, with a background in accounting, database management, and computer technology. Having worked on numerous adventure race team support crews across the globe in exotic and challenging locations, Hélène is well versed in race logistics. Hélène is the Race Promoter of the event series and is responsible for coordinating events including designing race courses, staffing, team support, event sponsorship and all administrative responsibilities involved in organization of international and national races.The Kids Adventure Games race directing team are a group of dedicated outdoor professionals who work hard at the safety, creativity and innovation of the courses. Grand Traverse Adventures has been race directing for the GoPro™ Mountain Gamesand World T.E.A.M. Sports, before creating the Kids Adventure Games™.  Other ways to helpContact us directly if you have ideas and introductions you may make for us to help further the event:
decision makers in companies for partner opportunities, sponsorship
vendors who would want to be apart of the expo (link on website)
volunteerism (link on website)
interns
speakers
influencers
swag and raffle prizes for the kids
foundation we may want to affiliate with
 Sponsorship areas
Gasoline Companies
Vehicles
Apparel
Energy Bars
Outdoor Equipment
Media Partner
Travel Partner
Lodging Partner
etc.
Thank you for sharing in your network, supporting our efforts and we will see you on course this summer! Our 2020 schedule will be reduced while we implement our strategic plan.

story:
Snappin’ Hammock originated from a passion for the outdoors and those perfect moments.  



Our team developed a new technology that SNAPS-BACK, STORES & PROTECTS your hammock. 

We designed an easy-to-use, snap-back, recoil apparatus that allows for quick set up and take down. It also features a mechanism to remove debris and water from your hammock as it winds back into its waterproof shell. Small, compact & easy to use, the Snappin’ Hammock can go anywhere you go. 

Our unique shell design snaps-back, cleans, stores and protects your hammock. Always there and always ready, the Snappin’ Hammock lets you grab your hammock and go, while also ensuring it stays clean and lasts longer.

The Snappin’ Hammock design was centered around giving you an easy-to-use, fast and simple product that optimizes your hammock-time. Let your mind wander as you relax in your hammock knowing its always there & always ready to go!

Tired of trying to pack your hammock back into that small bag? With the Snappin’ Hammock recoil mechanism your hammock snaps back into its shell with ease so you can focus on relaxing.  Like your grandma’s recoil vacuum cord but so much better. 

Inside the Snappin’ Hammock shell is a moisture control Silica Gel packet slot. Replace it annually to wick away and absorb moisture from your hammock. Reduce damp smells and decrease the chance of mildew or other unpleasant things caused by moisture. Let nature be the only scent on your hangs.

Made of lightweight, sturdy, scratch-resistant and recyclable plastic, this custom-shaped hammock holder is a cinch to carry as you hike.

Because everything you carry matters, this unit is as space-wise as it comes. Our tight spring load system inside, snaps your hammock back into its compact, hand-held shell.

Because sometimes, it rains. With the Snappin’ Hammock shell, enjoy water resistant protection from rain and water. The shell is mechanically sealed tight and the “mouth” of the shell has a small rubber gasket to keep water out.

Snappin’ Hammock can go anywhere with you. Perfect for festivals, camping, RVing or just hanging out in the park. Its quick and easy set-up, take down and easy storage makes your hammock the hit of any outdoor occasion. 

The Snappin’ Hammock is in prototype optimization stage. We need your help to continue testing and improving our prototype. Your support will drive market readiness and bring the Snappin’ Hammock to life.  

Our next step is working to reduce prototype size and start fitting, testing and creating the final mold before manufacturing our first product run in Summer 2018

Snappin’ is currently working with the existing prototype to reduce size and is focused on:

  • Optimizing CAD designs 
  • Reviewing snap-back recoil mechanisms  
  • Finalizing the engineering schematics

 

We will soon begin the process of:

  • 3D printing sample runs
  • Fit and form testing, Destructive testing, Viability testing
  • Designing the supply chain process
  • Tooling (Injection mold creation) 
  • Materials procurement 
  • Production 

Shell Specifications

Calling All Hammock Lovers

Here at Snappin’ Hammock we have been working hard over the past year to create the smallest and most convenient hammock ever.  We are calling all hammock lovers who share a passion for the outdoors.  Become a part of a movement, a community.  Let’s realize the possibility of having the most compact, easy to use, weatherproof hammock yet. 

Why Snappin'

Snappin’ Hammock is more than a hammock, it is a lifestyle.  We are a community of likeminded individuals who are obsessed with quality, the outdoors and giving back.  

We are starting to build our community; Snappin’ Hammock is proud to initiate our first give back campaign – Snappin’ For Trees – where we will plant a tree for every Snappin’ Hammock sold.  Trees planted will be focused on areas that have recently been devastated by wildfires and hurricanes (Western Canada and the Southern United States).

Meet the Snappin' Team

Ray B - Manufacturing, Inventor, Experienced Business Owner

Ray brings 35+ years of inventing and bringing new products to market in agriculture and outdoor leisure product industries. As an avid RV enthusiast he is always looking for way to improve his outdoor experience. 

Matt B - Manufacturing & Sales

Matt loves to build products. He has worked in sales and manufacturing for over 5 years with a focus on backyard & outdoor relaxation products. Originally from Scotland, Matt fell in love with the mountains and forests of the Canadian West Coast and looks forward to sharing his next product with you.

Laura M - Online Marketing

Laura brings over 10 years of retail, e-commerce, digital marketing and project management experience combined with a B-Com in Entrepreneurial Management. Originating from the beautiful west coast, she grew up enjoying nature and the outdoors.

Lisa W - Marketing Strategy

Lisa brings a retail and marketing focus with 25+ years of experience, combined with an MBA degree to help keep the Snappin’ Hammock strategy going strong. Her undergrad is in Environmental Studies and more importantly, she loves the escape of the outdoors and beauty of nature.

Mikenna T- Industrial Designer

With a Bachelor of Design and 3 years experience, Mikenna is a well-rounded designer with expertise in graphics and marketing collateral, product, medical, and furniture design. Mikenna loves adventuring in the outdoors and is always a crazy journey away from finding that epic spot for a hammock hang. 

Jason T - Professional Engineer

Jason brings a Professional Engineering (P.Eng) and Project Management Professional (PMP) designation to the team, with 7+ years of experience in the engineering design field.  Jason has a great passion for the outdoors. When he's not in the office you can find him in the mountains.

 

The Snappin' Hammock team would like to give a special thanks to Jeff Palmer (videographer) and Jesse Roper (musician) for their talents to help make our campaign a success. 

Help build our community. Share us with your friends and family!
Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter and share!

Q & A

 

1.     What is included in my Snappin' Hammock? 

Your Snappin' Hammock will include your waterproof shell and a 50x76 inch Slacker Hammock.  

2.     Are straps included? 

No they are not included.  

3.     What happens if you don't reach your goal? 

We will be refunding all backer's purchases if we don't reach our goal.  

4.     Can I put my own hammock in the Snappin' Hammock? 

Due to where the hammock attaches to the internal snap-back mechanism, there will be custom adjustments to the hammock that won't allow this.  We do hope to fix this issue in future versions of the Snappin' Hammock and have the ability to attach standard off the shelf hammocks.  

5.     Is there any other colours of the Snappin' Hammock? 

Currently the Snappin' Hammock shell only comes in black. 

6.     What colour is the Slacker Hammock? 

At this time we are offering 3 options of hammock colours to choose from: blue, green or grey. When making your contribution, please make note in the checkout of what colour you would like to receive.  

7.     What if my Snappin' Hammock breaks? 

If you're Snappin' Hammock shell breaks we will happily send you a new shell free of charge.  

 

Your feedback will drive our success. Please reach out with any further questions or comments you may have. We’re all ears!

Patent Pending on the Snappin' Hammock
